<L>5306<pc>204-a<k1>apogaRqa<k2>apogaRqa
{#apogaRqa#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-RqaH-RqA-Rqam#}) I. <sup>1</sup> Having a
limb too many or too few (e. g. twenty-one or nineteen,
fingers and toes together), deformed. <sup>2</sup> A child, an infant.
<sup>3</sup> Very timid, very fearful. The same as {#pogaRqa#} and {#pOgaRqa#}
(comp. {%Viśva'%}s {%Śabdabheda%} E. I. H. Ms. 1539. 246. and Ms.
R. S. {#pOgaRqaH syAdapogaRqaH#}). E. According to the native
Etym., a Tatpur. {#apas#} (= {#apa,#} āgama {#suw#}) and {#gaRqa#} ({#gam#}
uṇ. aff. {#qa#}) lit. ‘going badly: {#apakfzwaM gacCati#}’; but it would
seem preferable to assume that the word is in this sense
a Bahuvr. of {#apa#} (in its form {#apas#}) deter. and {#gaRqa#} (in a
lost sense ‘limb’).
<div n="P">II. Not under sixteen years of age.--In this sense the
word occurs in the edd. of {%Manu%} 8. 148., according to {%Kul-%}
{%lūka;%} when {#pogaRqa#} which, according to the {%Koshas,%} has
the meanings of {#apogaRqa#} I., assumes the special meaning
‘under sixteen years of age’; the two edd. of the {%Vyavah.%}
section of the {%Mitākṣara%} and several E. I. H. Mss. of the
Mit. who quote this verse (8<sup>vo</sup> ed. p. 43{%a,%} 1. 1; 4<sup>to</sup> ed. {#vya°#}
fol. 12{%a,%} 1. 13) read it {#apOgaRqa#} and repeat it in the same
form immediately afterwards (1. 4. and 1. 14), while the {%Vīra-%}
{%mitrodaya%} fol. 66{%a,%} 1. 1 reads {#apogaRqa#}. Comp. also the {%Mit.%}
8<sup>vo</sup> ed. p. 74, 1. 9, 4<sup>to</sup> ed. {#vya°#} fol. 20{%a,%} 1. 15. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pIgaRqa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5317<pc>204-b<k1>apoha<k2>apoha
{#apoha#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-haH#}) Removing, taking off; e. g. in the
{%Jaiminīya-nyāyam.:%} {#viSizwasya yadAdAnamanyApohena vastunaH .#}
{#arTAntaranyAsavatI parivfttirasO yaTA#}. Comp. {#apohana#} and
{#vyapoha#}. <sup>2</sup> Reasoning away, i. e. a reasoning which {%removes%}
one object from another or {%disconnects%} two objects; the re-
verse of {#Uha,#} the reasoning which establishes a relation
between two objects, i. e. which {%connects%} them (for the de-
tailed explanation of the latter term see, however, s. v. {#Uha#});
e. g. on the words of the {%Bhāgav. Purāṇa%} which speak of
the difference between Soul and Body: {#‘dehastu sarvasaMGAto#}
{#jagattasTuriti dviDA . atrEva mfgyaH puruzo neti netItyatattya-#}
{#jan’#} {%Śrīdharasvāmin%} observes: {#neti netItyanyApohe kriya-#}
{#mARe#} &c.; or in the {%Siddhāntamuktāvalī:%} {#apoharUpo nIla-#}
{#tvAdirvijYAnaDarma iti cet . na . nIlatvAdInAM virudDAnAme-#}
{#kasminnasamAveSAt#} ‘are blue, yellow and similar qualities
such properties of knowledge as must be disconnected from
it by reasoning? no, for contrary notions as blue, yellow &c.
cannot take place (at the same time in the same thing)’;
the Dwandwa {#UhApoha#} ‘positive and negative reasoning,
reasoning which {%connects%} and reasoning which {%disconnects’%}
is therefore also used in the sense of ‘thorough or clever
reasoning, sharpness or cleverness of intellect’; e. g. in
{%Bharatasena%} on a verse of the {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#UhApohakzamErna SukA-#}
{#divadaDItavaktftvam;#} or {%Mādhava%} says of a work on car-
pentry: {#UhApohakuSalapuruzotprekzAmUlA takzasmftirna vedaM kalpa-#}
{#yituM praBavati#}.--{%Hemachandra%} calls {#apoha#} one of the eight
qualities of intellect ({#SuSrUzA SravaRaM cEva grahaRaM DAraRaM taTA#}
{#Uho'poho'rTavijYAnaM tattvajYAnaM ca DIguRAH#}), but this piece
of psychology seems to belong to him as exclusively as his
definition of {#apAna#}. E. {#Uh#} with {#apa,#} kṛt aff. {#GaY#}.
<LEND>

<L>5318<pc>204-b<k1>apohana<k2>apohana
{#apohana#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-nam#}) Removing, taking off, destroying;
e. g. in the {%Bhagavadgītā%} (15. 15.) Viṣṇu says: {#mattaH smf-#}
{#tirjYAnamapohanaM ca#} ‘from me comes recollection and know-
[Page205-a+ 56]
ledge (scil. of virtuous acts) and the removal (i. e. the
cessation of recollection and of knowledge of sinful acts)’.
{%Śaṅkara:%} {#matta AtmanaH sarvaprARinAM smftirjYAnaM tadapohanaM ca .#}
{#yezAM puRyakarmaRAM puRyakarmAnuroDena jYAnasmftI BavataH . taTA#}
{#pApakarmaRAM pApakarmAnuroDena smftijYAnayorapohanamapagamanaM ca;#}
{%Sadānanda:%} {#matta Atmana evAtaH prARijAtasya ca smftiH .#}
{#etajjanmani pUrvAnuBUtArTavizayA ca sA . janmAntarAnuBUtArTavi-#}
{#zayApyasti yoginAm . vizayendriyasaMyogajanyaM jYAnaM taTAtmanaH .#}
{#dikkAlaviprakfzwEkavizayaM cApi yoginAm . matta eva tayoH#}
{#kAmakroDAdyAkulacetasAm . pApakarmAnuroDena vinASaH smfti-#}
{#boDayoH ..;#} {%Arjunamiśra:%} {#matta eva hetoH prARijAtasya pUrvA-#}
{#nuBUtArTavizayA smftirBavati . jYAnaM ca vizayendriyasaMprayogajaM#}
{#Bavati . apohanaM ca tayoH pramozo Bavati ..;#} similarly {%Madhu-%}
{%sūdhana:%} {#…apohanaM ca smftijYAnayorapApaSca matta eva#}
{#Bavati#}.] E. {#Uh#} with {#apa,#} kṛt aff. {#lyuw#}.
<LEND>

<L>5326<pc>205-a<k1>apkftsnasamADi<k2>apkftsnasamADi

and {#samADi#}.

<L>5328<pc>205-a<k1>apta<k2>apta
{#apta#}¦ m. f. n. ({#-ptaH-ptA-ptam#}) (ved.) Obtained, acquired, reached

obsolete as far as the verbal inflection is concerned, where

{#ap,#} pref. {#A#}), kṛt aff. {#kta#}.

<L>5329<pc>205-a<k1>aptas<k2>aptas

{#karmaRi,#} where it is not a various reading of {#apas, Apas#}
or {#apnas#} qq. vv.). E. {#Ap#} with {#A#} shortened (acc. to the

<L>5330<pc>205-b<k1>aptu<k2>aptu
{#aptu#}¦ m. ({#-ptuH#}) (ved.) <sup>1</sup> Soma. <sup>2</sup> A sacrificial animal. <sup>3</sup> Body.
<sup>4</sup> A desired object, or object of desire (perhaps more cor-
rectly: attainment, scil. of a desired object). <sup>5</sup> Possessing,
comprising. [The two first meanings are two various inter-
pretations of the word in {%Vājas.%} 5. 35. or {%Śatap.%} III. 6. 3. 8.:
{#juzARo apturAjyasya vetu#} (quoted also by the {%Kāśikā%} on {%Pāṇ.%}
VI. 1. 118.), viz. {%Śayaṇa:%} {#aptuH sUkzmarUpaH somaH,#} or {%Mahīdh.:%}
{#aptuScAtra somaH . Apnoti pItaH saYCarIram#} i. e. ‘Soma, be-
cause it comes into the body’; and {%Nṛsinha%} in the {%Swara-%}
{%mañjarī:%} {#apturyajYiyaH paSuH#} (probably as connected with
{#aptas#}); the third meaning is that given by {%-Bhaṭṭojid.%} on
the {%Uṇ. Sūtra%} 1. 74. (perhaps because body is pervaded by
Soma); the fourth meaning results from {%Bhaṭṭoj.'%}s {%Prauḍham.%}
but belongs apparently to the word only in {#aptoryAma#} q. v.
where it would have also the fifth meaning, according to a
passage from the Śatap. quoted s. v. {#aptoryAma;#} in either
of the last two meanings {#aptoH#} represents probably the
{%abl.%} of the abstract noun in {#-tu#} which in the Vedas often
assumes the function of our infinitive, expressed in the
classical idiom by the accus. {#-tum, aptos#} being thus equal
in value to the classical {#Aptum#}.] E. {#Ap#} with shortened
{#A#} (accord. to the native etym., but more correctly {#ap,#}
comp. the etym. of {#apta#}), uṇ. aff. {#tu#}.
<LEND>

<L>5331<pc>205-b<k1>aptur<k2>aptur
{#aptur#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-ptUH#}) (ved.) <sup>1</sup> Sending water (i. e. rain),
an epithet of Indra, Agni &c. <sup>2</sup> Quick as water (i. e. as
the falling rain), an epithet of the horses of the Aśvins.
E. {#ap#} and {#tur#}.
<LEND>

<LEND>

<L>5333<pc>205-b<k1>aptoryAma<k2>aptoryAma
{#aptoryAma#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-maH#}) (ved.) <sup>1</sup> The name of a sacrifice,
viz. of the seventh or last part ({%somasansthā%}) of the {%Jyo-%}
{%tiṣṭoma;%} ({%Mādhava%} in enumerating the seven parts of the
{%Jyotiṣṭoma,%} in his {%Jaiminiyanyāyam.,%}--accord. to all the
Mss. of this work within my reach--makes it, the sixth part
of the latter, but he is at variance in this respect with the
older authorities of the {%Kalpasūtras%} and of {%Kumārila'%}s
{%Vārttikas%}); it is not {%nitya%} or obligatory for the performance
of this sacrifice, like the {%Agniṣṭoma%} (q. v.), but {%kāmya%} or
voluntary, and instituted merely for the attainment of a
specific desire. See {#jyotizwoma#}. <sup>2</sup> The name of a Śamaveda-
verse, becauses it closes the ceremonies connected with the
sacrifice of this name. E. {#aptos#} (abl. of {#aptu#}) and {#yAma#}.
The literal meaning of this word would be in conformity
with the definition of the {%Prauḍhamanoramā,%} ‘a sacrifice
which procures the attainment of the desired object’: {#aptuH#}
{#SarIramiti . aBilazitArTaSca . AptavyatvAt . ata evAptoryA-#}
{#maSabdasyABilazitArTaprApaka ityavayavArTamAhuH,#} when {#aptoH#}
would be, not the ablat., but the genitive of {#aptu#} 4. q. v.,
and {#yAma#} have the sense of {#prApaka;#} but it is more probable
that {#yAma#} means ‘termination’ and that {#aptoH#} represents
the abl. of {#aptu#} q. v., i. e. ‘the last part (scil. of the Jyoti-
[Page206-a+ 56]
ṣṭoma, performed) on account of obtaining, scil. the de-
sired object’; according to the comm. of {%Śatap.%} XIII. 7.
1. 9., however, the word would derive its meaning from
‘the Aptoryāma sacrifice and verse {%including%} the sacrifices
and verses called severally Agniṣṭoma, Ukthya, Shoḍaśin
and Atirātra qq. vv.’: {%Śatap.%} {#sarvezAM yajYakratUnAmAptyE;#} {%Ha-%}
{%risvāmin:%} {#sarvezAM yajYakratUnAmiti . sarvARyagnizwomokTyazoqa-#}
{#SyatirAtranAmAni#} [to be read thus probably instead of the
meaningless {#‘°nAmiM#} (?)’ in the present publication of Ex-
tracts from this comm.] {#stotraSastrARi cAptoryAme'ntarBavantI-#}
{#tyaBiprAyaH;#} when {#aptoH#} would mean ‘on account of ob-
taining or comprising’, scil. Agniṣṭoma &c.
<LEND>

<L>5343<pc>206-a<k1>appa<k2>appa
{#appa#}¦ m. ({#-ppaH#}) The name of a Telugu poet, who ‘wrote a
work on prosody called Appakavi-chhāndasa and another
work called Vrindāsambhava which is an account of the
birth and parentage of Vrinda, the chaste wife of a giant’
…‘the manner of the death of this poet is unknown, nor
have the names of any of his (other) works been preserved’.
--He is not considered to be the same as {#apyayadIkzita#}
q. v. E. unknown.

<L>5348<pc>206-b<k1>apya<k2>apya

<L>5351<pc>206-b<k1>apyaya<k2>apyaya
{#apyaya#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-yaH#}) <sup>1</sup> (ved.) Union, junction. <sup>2</sup> Going
into, esp. metaphorically, absorption, e. g. {#svApyaya#} ‘pro-
found sleep’ q. v.; destruction, when contrasted with {#praBava#}
‘birth, origin’ ({#praBavApyayO = utpattipralayO#}). Comp. {#apI-#}
{#ti#} and {#apyayana#}. E. {#i#} with {#api,#} kṛt aff. {#ac#}.
<LEND>

<L>5352<pc>206-b<k1>apyayadIkzita<k2>apyayadIkzita
{#apyayadIkzita#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-taH#}) The name of a celebrated
Dravida Brahmaṇa, the son of {%Nārāyaṇadīkṣita;%} he lived
at Agrahara and flourished in the 16<sup>th</sup> century of Śālivā-
hana; his contemporaries considered him as an emanation
of Śiva on account of his devotion for this god and his
great learning, for ‘at the age of twelve years he perfectly
studied the Vedas and was besides master of several ab-
struse sciences’. In his crusade for establishing the supe-
riority of Śivaism he was once waylayed in a forest by
ruffians, hired by one of his unvictorious opponents at the
court of Vankatapati, but rescued by timely aid. He
died at Chillumbrum, as it appears, at the age of ninety.
He is said to be the author of 84 books on theology, rhe-
toric and philosophy. {%Colebrooke%} names (essays I. 333. 337)
two of his Vedānta works; {%Wilson%} (in the introd. to the
{%Daśakumārach.%} p. 5) his abridged version of the first portion
of the Daśak. and his work on rhetoric, the {%Kuvālayānanda%}
(comp. also Journal As. serie IV. vol. XI. p. 529); a vo-
cabulary of his is mentioned in {%Weber'%}s Catalogue of the
Berlin Sanskr. Ms. (No. 806), and the Pandit {%Cavelly Ven-%}
{%kata Rāmasvāmin%} who is answerable for the data alleged
before, enumerates among his Śivaitic writings the {%Śivār-%}
{%chanā-chandrikā, Śiva-tattwa-viveka, Śiva-maṇi-dīpika%} and
the {%Ātmārpaṇa.%}--His name occurs also in the shape of
{#apyAyadIkzita, apyEdIkzita, apyadIkzita, appidIkzita, appa-#}
{#dIkzita, apyayya;#} but he is not the same as {#appa#} q. v. E.
{#apyaya#} and {#dIkzita#}.
<LEND>

<L>5353<pc>206-b<k1>apyayana<k2>apyayana
{#apyayana#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-nam#}) Union, junction, copulation; see
{#apIti#} and {#apyaya#}. E. {#i#} with {#api,#} kṛt aff. {#lyuw#}.
<LEND>

<L>5354<pc>206-b<k1>apyayya<k2>apyayya
{#apyayya#}.¦ See {#apyayadIkzita#}.
<LEND>

<L>5355<pc>207-a<k1>apyarDa<k2>apyarDa
{#apyarDa#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-rDaH-rDA-rDam#}) (ved.) Near, contiguous;
{#apyarDam#} near to. Comp. {#aByarDa#} and {#aByarRa#}. E. {#api#} and {#arDa#}.
<LEND>

<LEND>

<L>5359<pc>207-a<k1>aprakawa<k2>aprakawa

<LEND>

<L>5360<pc>207-a<k1>aprakampa<k2>aprakampa
{#aprakampa#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-mpaH-mpA-mpam#}) <sup>1</sup> Unshaken, lit. and
figur., firm, steady; e. g. {#aprakampaM hfdayam#}. <sup>2</sup> Unanswered,
unrefuted. E. {#a#} priv. and {#prakampa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5361<pc>207-a<k1>aprakampatA<k2>aprakampatA
{#aprakampatA#}¦ f. ({#-tA#}) or {#aprakampatva#} n. ({#-tvam#}) <sup>1</sup> Firmness, stability.
<sup>2</sup> Unanswerableness. E. {#aprakampa,#} taddh. aff. {#tal#} or {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5362<pc>207-a<k1>aprakara<k2>aprakara
{#aprakara#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-raH-rA-ram#}) Not acting in a superior
manner, acting ill; ({%Amarūśataka-ṭīkā:%} = {#aprakfzwakAraka#}).
E. {#a#} neg. and {#prakara#}.
<LEND>

<L>5363<pc>207-a<k1>aprakaraRa<k2>aprakaraRa
{#aprakaraRa#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-Ram#}) The not being the principal or
relevant matter, incidental or irrelevant matter (of a book,
a discussion &c.); e. g. {%Śaṅkara%} on a passage of the {%Bṛhadār.:%}
{#jYAnakarmaRI eva hi meDAtapaHSabdavAcye . tayoH prakftatvAnnetare#}
{#meDAtapasI . aprakaraRAt;#} applied also to those passages in
the Brāhmaṇas which are considered as not connected with,
or irrelevant to, the principal topics of an injunction with
which they may happen to be found together in the same
chapter or book, and which therefore do not share in the
rules that apply to the latter, but become the subject of
special injunctions; comp. {#anAraByADIta#} and the following;
e. g. in the {%Jaimini Sūtra:%} {#aprakaraRe tu tadDarmato viSezAt#}.
E. {#a#} neg. and {#prakaraRa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5364<pc>207-a<k1>aprakalpaka<k2>aprakalpaka
{#aprakalpaka#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-lpakaH-lpikA-lpakam#}) Not en-
joining, not making principal or relevant, not having the
effect of making one injunction as relevant or obligatory
as other injunctions with which the former may happen to
be found together in the same book or chapter, e. g. of a
Brāhmaṇa (comp. the preceding and {#anAraByADIta#}); e. g. in
the {%Jaimini Sūtra:%} {#SAstraM syAdaprakalpakam#} (scil. {#smfteH#}); {%Śabara:%}
{#tasmAnnAsyAH smfteH SAstraM prakalpakam#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prakalpaka#}.
<LEND>

<L>5365<pc>207-a<k1>aprakARqa<k2>aprakARqa
{#aprakARqa#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-RqaH-RqA-Rqam#}) Without a stem
(as a shrub). E. {#a#} priv. and {#prakARqa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5366<pc>207-a<k1>aprakAra<k2>aprakAra
{#aprakAra#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-raH-rA-ram#}) Not producing, not
manifesting; e. g. in the {%Bhāṣāparichchheda:%} {#tadaBAvApra-#}
{#kArA DIstatprakArA tu niScayaH#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prakAra#}.
<LEND>

<L>5367<pc>207-a<k1>aprakASa<k2>aprakASa
{#aprakASa#}¦ I. Tatpur. or Bahuvr. 1. m. f. n. ({#-SaH-SA-Sam#}) <sup>1</sup> Not
bright, not clear, dark; e. g. in the {%Hidimb.:%} {#aprakASA diSaH#}
{#sarvAH#}. <sup>2</sup> Private, secret, not evident, without a witness;
e. g. in the {%Vīramitrodaya:%} (of a deed) {#aprakASAtsAkziyuktaM#}
{#leKakAkzaramudritam . lokaprasidDaM svakftAdvaramanyakftaM SuBam;#}
{#aprakASam#} also used as adv.; e. g. {%Kullūka:%} {#pitfgfhe kanyA#}
{#yaM putramaprakASaM janayettaM kanyApariRetuH putraM nAmnA kAnInaM vadet;#}
or {#aprakASamutpannaH putraH#}. E. {#a#} neg. or priv. and {#prakASa#}.
<div n="P">II. Tatpur. m. ({#-SaH#}) <sup>1</sup> Want of brightness or clearness,
darkness, lit. or figur.; e. g. in the comm. of the {%Raghu-%}
{%vanśa:%} {#so'haM…prakASaScAnDakAraSca lokAloka ivAcalaH#}
(comm. {#ekasminpArSve prakASayuktaH . aparasminpArSve'prakASayukta#}
{#iti BAvaH#}). <sup>2</sup> Secrecy. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prakASa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5368<pc>207-a<k1>aprakASaka<k2>aprakASaka
{#aprakASaka#}¦ m. f. n. ({#-SakaH-SikA-Sakam#}) I. Tatpur. Not ir-
radiating, not rendering apparent. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prakASaka#}.
[Page207-b+ 56]
<div n="P">II. Making obscure, obfuscating. E. {#aprakASi#} (denom.
of {#aprakASa,#} aff. {#Ric#}), kṛt aff. {#Rvul#}.
<LEND>

<L>5369<pc>207-b<k1>aprakASakagraha<k2>aprakASakagraha
{#aprakASakagraha#}¦ Karmadh. m. ({#-haH#}) (In Astronomy.) The same
as <sup>1</sup> {#DUmaketu#}. <sup>2</sup> {#pAta#}. <sup>3</sup> {#pariDi#}. <sup>4</sup> {#indraketu#}. <sup>5</sup> {#vizaketu#} qq. vv.
E. {#aprakASaka#} and {#graha#}.
<LEND>

<L>5371<pc>207-b<k1>aprakASamAna<k2>aprakASamAna

<L>5372<pc>207-b<k1>aprakASita<k2>aprakASita
{#aprakASita#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) Not manifested,
not evident, not divulged, unrevealed; e. g. in the {%Mitā-%}
{%kshara:%} {#svaM laBetAnyavikrItaM kreturdoze'prakASite . hInAdraho#}
{#hInamUlye velAhIne ca taskaraH;#} or {#aprakASitAtmano vyaBicA-#}
{#rAtpuruzAntarasaMBogasaMkalpAdyadapuRyaM tasyartO rajodarSane SudDiH#}.
E. {#a#} neg. and {#prakASita#}.
<LEND>

<L>5373<pc>207-b<k1>aprakASya<k2>aprakASya

{#aprakASyaM paraM guhyaM rahasyaM sarvakAmadam#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prakASya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5374<pc>207-b<k1>aprakIrRaprasftatva<k2>aprakIrRaprasftatva
{#aprakIrRaprasftatva#}¦ n. ({#-tvam#}) I. The being neither (too) inco-
herent nor (too) prolix; or
<div n="P">II. Tatpur. The being diffuse (i. e. eloquent) on a concise
subject; one of the thirty five excellent qualities in the
speech of a Jaina Arhat. E. I. {#a#} neg. and {#prakIrRa-prasfta,#}
taddh. aff. {#tva;#} or II. {#aprakIrRa#} and {#prasftatva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5382<pc>207-b<k1>apragama<k2>apragama
{#apragama#}¦ m. f. n. ({#-maH-mA-mam#}) I. Tatpur. Invincible; or
<div n="P">II. Bahuvr. Not going well (with others), i. e. going too
fast to be accompanied by others a long distance. (Both
interpretations of the word are given in the passage of the
{%Bhaṭṭikāvya:%} {#udapatadviyadapragamaH parE ruciram#} &c. ({%Jayam.%}
and {%Bharatas.:%} {#parEH SatruBirapragamo'naBiBavanIyaH;#} or {%Jayam.:%}
{#apragamo'nyezAmityarTAt;#} {%Bharatas.:%} {#parEH saha nAsti prakfzwaM#}
{#gamanaM yasyetyarTaH . atiSIGragAmitvAt,#} the word {#parEH#} of the
text depending in the latter interpretation not upon {#apragamaH#}
but on {#ruciram#} and not meaning then ‘enemy’, but ‘ex-
cellent’). E. I. {#a#} neg. and {#pragama#} (= {#na pragamyate'sO,#} i. e.
{#gam#} with {#pra,#} kṛt aff. {#ap#}). II. {#a#} priv. and {#pragama#} (i. e. {#pra#}
and {#gama#}).
<LEND>

{#niyataM dUrataScApragalBaH;#} or in the {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#strIBUzaRaM cezwitama-#}

<L>5394<pc>208-a<k1>apracyuta<k2>apracyuta

a noun in the abl. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pracyuta#}.
<LEND>

<L>5395<pc>208-a<k1>apraja<k2>apraja
{#apraja#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-jaH-jA-jam#}) <sup>1</sup> Unborn; e. g. in
the {%Ṛgv.:%} {#aprajAH santvatriRaH#} ‘may the demons not come
into existence’ ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#anutpannAH santu#}). <sup>2</sup> Not productive
(of children), unprolific; e. g. {#mETunam#}.
<div n="P">2. m. ({#-jaH#}) A man who has not begot (children);
e. g. {%Vṛhaspati%} (as quoted by the {%Vīramitrodaya%}): {#sapiRqa-#}
{#syAprajasyAMSaM sTAvaraM saptaDAkftam#}.
<div n="P">3. f. ({#-jA#}) <sup>1</sup> A female who has not borne (a child); e. g.
{%Vṛddhakātyāyana%} (as quoted in the {%Dāyat.%}): {#pitfByAM cEva#}
{#yaddattaM duhituH sTAvaraM Danam . aprajAyAmatItAyAM BrAtfgAmi#}
{#tu sarvadA#}. <sup>2</sup> One who cannot bear, a barren female; e. g.
in {%Kumārila'%}s {%Mīmānsā Vārtt.:%} {#prajA daSa mAsAngarBaM DftvA#}
{#ekAdaSamanu prajAyante tasmAdaSvataryo'prajAH#}. E. {#a#} neg. and
{#praja#}. (This word is always {%Tatpur.,%} with the udātta on
the first syllable, and must not be analyzed as a {%Bahuvr.%}
of {#a#} priv. and {#prajA,#} for {%Pāṇini%} enjoins V. 4. 122., that the
latter assumes {%‘always’%} the form {#aprajas,#} and his rule is
neither contradicted nor restricted by any of his commen-
tators; the meanings of {#apraja#} and {#aprajas#} will often coin-
cide in bearing--comp. also {#aprajAtA, apaprajAtA, apra-#}
{#sUtA--,#} but their difference will be perceived in such in-
stances as given above, e. g. in {#aSvataryo'prajAH#} when the
Bahuvr. epithet ‘without progeny’ would alter the sense,
or in {%Chāṇakya'%}s {#mETunamaprajam,#} since it would be absurd to
speak of a {#mETuna#} ‘without children’, instead of an unpro-
lific one.)
<LEND>
[Page208-b+ 56]

<L>5396<pc>208-b<k1>aprajajYi<k2>aprajajYi
{#aprajajYi#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-jYiH-jYiH-jYi#}) (ved.) <sup>1</sup> Unpro-
lific. <sup>2</sup> Ignorant, unwise, unacquainted with. E. {#a#} neg.
and {#prajajYi#} I. and II.
<LEND>

<L>5397<pc>208-b<k1>aprajas<k2>aprajas
{#aprajas#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-jAH-jAH-jaH#}) <sup>1</sup> Childless, without
progeny; e. g. {%Yājnavalkya:%} {#atItAyAmaprajasi bAnDavastada-#}
{#vApnuyuH . aprajaHstrIDanaM BarturbrAhmAdizu caturzvapi#}.--See the
remark s. v. {#apraja#}. <sup>2</sup> Destitute of subjects, of inhabitants,
unpeopled. E. {#a#} priv. and {#prajA,#} samās. aff. {#asic#}.
<LEND>

<L>5398<pc>208-b<k1>aprajastA<k2>aprajastA

of progeny. E. {#aprajas,#} taddh. aff. {#tal#} or {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5399<pc>208-b<k1>aprajAtA<k2>aprajAtA
{#aprajAtA#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-tA#}) The same as {#aprajA#} q. v. (s. v.
{#apraja#} 3.). <sup>1</sup> A female who has not borne (a child); e. g. a {%Smṛti%}
quoted in the {%Mitākṣara:%} {#brAhmaRakzatriyaviSAM BAryA SUdreRa#}
{#saMgatAH . aprajAtA viSuDyanti prAyaScittena netarAH#}. <sup>2</sup> A
barren female; e. g. {%Suśruta:%} {#aprajAtArogAMSca cikitsedutta-#}
{#rAdBizak#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prajAta#}.
<LEND>

<L>5400<pc>208-b<k1>aprajAstva<k2>aprajAstva

edition of the {%Atharvaveda%}). E. {#aprajas,#} taddh. aff. {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5403<pc>208-b<k1>apraRIta<k2>apraRIta

called {#praRItAH#} q. v. E. {#a#} priv. and {#praRItA;#} scil. {#karman#}.

<L>5404<pc>208-b<k1>apraRodya<k2>apraRodya
{#apraRodya#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-dyaH-dyA-dyam#}) Not to be removed,

{#sAyamapi#} ({%Mitākṣara:%} = {#apratyAKyeyaH#}). E. {#a#} neg. and {#praRodya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5405<pc>208-b<k1>apratarkya<k2>apratarkya
{#apratarkya#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-rkyaH-rkyA-rkyam#}) Not to be argued,
uninvestigable, not to be comprehended by discussion, as
the quality {#tamas;#} e. g. {%Manu:%} {#yattu syAnmohasaMyuktamavyaktaM vi-#}
{#zayAtmakam . apratarkyamavijYeyaM tamastadupaDArayet#}. E. {#a#} neg.
and {#pratarkya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5406<pc>208-b<k1>aprat<k2>aprat
{#aprat#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-n-tI-t#}) (ved.) Not possessed of
great wealth, not rich; in the {%Ṛgv.;%} {#na somo apratA pape#}
({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#apratA avistIrRaDanena#}). E. {#a#} priv. and {#prat#}.
<LEND>

<L>5407<pc>208-b<k1>apratApa<k2>apratApa
{#apratApa#}¦ I. Tatpur. m. ({#-paH#}) <sup>1</sup> Want of brilliancy, dullness.
<sup>2</sup> Want of dignity or power, meanness. E. {#a#} neg. and
{#pratApa#}.
<div n="P">II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-paH-pA-pam#}) <sup>1</sup> Dim, dull. <sup>2</sup> Without
dignity or power. E. {#a#} priv. and {#pratApa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5408<pc>208-b<k1>aprati<k2>aprati
{#aprati#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-tiH-tiH-ti#}) (ved.) <sup>1</sup> Without ad-
versaries; e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%} {#ya eka idapratirmanyamAnaH#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%}
= {#pratidvandvirahitaH#}). <sup>2</sup> Not encountered by, unimpeded by,
adversaries; e. g. in the neuter acc. used as adv. {%Ṛgv.:%}
{#vftrARyaprati barhizmate ni sahasrARi barhayaH#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} = {#Satru-#}
{#BirapratigataH#}). <sup>3</sup> Without hostility; e. g. in the neuter acc.
used as adv. ‘so as to cease to be hostile’, e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%}
{#haTo apratyasurasya vIrAn#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} = {#pratidvandvino yaTA na#}
{#Bavanti taTA#}). <sup>4</sup> Without retreat, not receding, encountering;
e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%} {#stuta indro maGavA yadDa vftrA BUrIRyeko apratIni#}
{#hanti#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} = {#apratigamanAni . aBigamanayuktAnItyarTaH#}).
<sup>5</sup> Unequalled, excellent, as treasures; e. g. {%Ṛgv.:%} {#so apra-#}
{#tIni manave purURIndro dASaddASuze#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} = {#utkfzwAni#}
[Page209-a+ 56]
{#DanAni#}); comp. also {#apratikarman, apratirUpa#} &c. and {#apra-#}
{#tima#}. E. {#a#} priv. and {#prati#}.
<LEND>

<L>5430<pc>209-b<k1>apratipatti<k2>apratipatti
{#apratipatti#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-ttiH#}) <sup>1</sup> Want of understanding or
ascertaining, not understanding, not ascertaining; e. g. in the
{%Nyāya Sūtra:%} {#vipratipattirapratipattiSca nigrahasTAnam#} (comm.:
{#apratipattiH prakftAjYAnam#}); or {%Patanjali%} in the introd. to
{%Pāṇini:%} {#SabdApratipattiH . SabdAnAM cApratipattiH prApnoti vyA-#}
{#karaRAcCabdAnpratipadyAmaha iti#}. <sup>2</sup> Confusion, perplexity; e. g.
{#apratipattirjaqatA syAdizwAnizwadarSanaSrutiBiH#}. <sup>3</sup> Not returning
(an answer); e. g. {#uttarasyApratipattirapratiBA;#} comp. {#apra-#}
{#tiBA#}. <sup>4</sup> (In the Mīmānsā philosophy.) A sacrificial act which
is not immaterial to the performance of a sacrifice (see {#saM-#}
{#skAra#} and comp. {#apUrva#} I. 1. 2. 1.), one essentially required for
the completion of the sacrifice. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratipatti#}.
<LEND>

<L>5435<pc>209-b<k1>apratibanDa<k2>apratibanDa
{#apratibanDa#}¦ I. Tatpur. m. ({#-nDaH#}) Non-obstruction, non-hin-
drance; e. g. in the {%Vedānta Sūtra:%} {#tannirDAraRAniyamastaddfzweH#}
{#pfTagGyapratibanDaH Palam#} ({%Śaṅkara:%} {#…karmaPalasidDyapratibanDaH#});
{#apratibanDena#} ‘without obstruction’; e. g. {#apratibanDena pravarta-#}
{#mAnaH#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratibanDa#}.
<div n="P">II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-nDaH-nDA-nDam#}) Unobstructed, un-
impeded.--In {%Law,%} when applied to {#dAya#} ‘inheritance’,
{%unconditional%} or {%direct,%} viz. such property as devolves in
direct descent from the father on the son, from the son on
[Page210-a+ 56]
the grandson &c., and is the converse of {#sapratibanDa,#} the
{%conditional%} or {%collateral%} inheritance, viz. property which
devolves on the lateral line, the uncle &c. on the condition
that there be no direct heirs, their existence being the ob-
struction or impediment, as it were, of the title to the
property which in the former case arises by birth-right or
‘without impediment’. [{%Mitākṣara:%} {#sa ca#} (scil. {#dAyo#}) {#dvi-#}
{#viDaH . apratibanDaH sapratibanDaSca . tatra putrARAM pOtrARAM ca#}
{#putratvena pOtratvena ca pitfDanaM pitAmahaDanaM ca svaM BavatItyaprati-#}
{#banDo dAyaH . pitfvyaBrAtrAdInAM tu putrABAve svAmyaBAve ca#}
{#svaM BavatIti putrasadBAvaH svAmisadBAvaSca pratibanDastadaBAve BrA-#}
{#tftvena ca pitfvyatvena ca svaM BavatIti sapratibanDo dAyaH . evaM#}
{#tatputrAdizvapyUhanIyaH ..;#} {%Viramitrodaya:%} {#putrAdInAM pitrAdi-#}
{#Dane putratvAdinEva satyapi svAmini pitrAdO janmanEva svatvo-#}
{#tpatteH sa tezAmapratibanDo dAyaH . svAmisadBAvasyApratibanDa-#}
{#katvAt . yastu viBaktasyAsaMsfzwino'putrasya mftasya pitfBrAtrA-#}
{#dInAM tadDanarUpo dAyaH sa sapratibanDaH . svAmisadBAvasya prati-#}
{#banDakasyApagama eva tatra svatvotpatteH#}.] E. {#a#} priv. and {#pratibanDa#}.
<LEND>

same as {#apratibanDa#} II. E. {#a#} priv. and {#pratibanDa,#} samās.
aff. {#kap#}.

<L>5439<pc>210-a<k1>apratiBa<k2>apratiBa
{#apratiBa#}¦ I. Tatpur. f. ({#-BA#}) <sup>1</sup> Want of boldness. <sup>2</sup> (In the
Nyāya philosophy.) Want of ready wit or of presence of
mind, in a discussion, viz. inability of returning an answer,
although one has understood the argument of the opponent
(therefore not necessarily the same as {#ananuBAzaRa#} q. v.),
one of the twenty-two {#nigrahasTAna#} or shortcomings in dis-
cussion. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratiBA#}.
<div n="P">II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-BaH-BA-Bam#}) <sup>1</sup> Not bold. <sup>2</sup> Not
of ready wit, dull. E. {#a#} priv. and {#pratiBA#}.
<LEND>

<L>5440<pc>210-a<k1>apratima<k2>apratima

equalled. E. {#a#} priv. and {#pratimA#}.

<L>5443<pc>210-a<k1>apratiyogin<k2>apratiyogin

<L>5444<pc>210-a<k1>apratiraTa<k2>apratiraTa
{#apratiraTa#}¦ Bahuvr. 1. m. ({#-TaH#}) <sup>1</sup> A leader in combat, a
prominent warrior (liter. ‘with incomparable chariots’:
= {#atulyaraTaH#} or {#mahAraTaH#}). <sup>2</sup> The name of a Ṛṣi, a son
of Indra and the reputed author of the {%Sāmaveda%} verses
2. 1199-1225. (= II. 9. 3. 1-9.), but according to some only of
2. 1199-1212. (= II. 9. 3. 1-5. a. b. or {%Ṛgv.%} 10. 103. or {%Vāj.%} 17.
33-44. 46.; for {%Vāj.%} 17. 60. see {#pratiraTa;#} see the very careful
compilation of the names of the poets &c. by {%Benfey%} in his
ed. of the {%Sāmaveda%}). <sup>3</sup> The name of a descendant of Puru:
[Page210-b+ 56]
a son of Rantināra and the father of Kaṇva (accord. to the
{%Viṣṇup.;%} the {%Agni-%} and {%Brāhmapur.%} read his name: Pratiratha).
<div n="P">2. n. ({#-Tam#}) The name of the hymn composed by the
Ṛṣi Apratiratha; chanting it on journeys is considered an
auspicious act. E. {#aprati#} and {#raTa;#} (but as the word is udātta
on the first syllable, it might have to be analyzed perhaps
as a Tatpur. of {#a#} neg. and {#pratiraTa#}).
<LEND>

<L>5445<pc>210-b<k1>apratirava<k2>apratirava
{#apratirava#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-vaH-vA-vam#}) Free from dispute,
uncontested (as the enjoyment of property); e. g. {%Mitā-%}
{%kshara:%} {#varzaSatADikaBogaH saMtato'pratiravaH…svatvaM gama-#}
{#yati#}. Comp. {#aparavojJita#}. E. {#a#} priv. and {#pratirava#}.
<LEND>

<L>5446<pc>210-b<k1>apratirUpa<k2>apratirUpa
{#apratirUpa#}¦ m. f. n. ({#-paH-pA-pam#}) I. Tatpur. Not conformable
to, at variance with, (e. g. words not in accordance with
the sacred writings). E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratirUpa#}.
<div n="P">II. Bahuvr. Of incomparable form, unequalled. E. {#aprati#}
and {#rUpa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5447<pc>210-b<k1>apratirUpakaTA<k2>apratirUpakaTA
{#apratirUpakaTA#}¦ Karmadh. f. ({#-TA#}) Incomparable, i. e. unan-
swerable, speech. E. {#apratirUpa#} and {#kaTA#}.
<LEND>

<L>5448<pc>210-b<k1>apratirUpavadana<k2>apratirUpavadana
{#apratirUpavadana#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-nam#}) Saying what is at variance
with (e. g. the sacred writings). [As a Karmadh. the word
might mean: an incomparable or very beautiful face; and
as a Bahuvr., having such a face.] E. {#apratirUpa#} and {#vadana#}.
<LEND>

{#aprativIrya#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-ryaH-ryA-ryam#}) Of incomparable
valour. E. {#aprati#} and {#vIrya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5450<pc>210-b<k1>apratiSabdita<k2>apratiSabdita

not met with a refusal. <sup>2</sup> Not denying, compliant. <sup>3</sup> Not
echoed(?). E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratiSabdita#}.
<LEND>

<L>5451<pc>210-b<k1>apratizidDa<k2>apratizidDa
{#apratizidDa#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-dDaH-dDA-dDam#}) <sup>1</sup> Not forbidden,
not prohibited, e. g. a religious act. <sup>2</sup> (In Grammar.) Not
accompanied with a particle or word expressing negation,
as a verb; e. g. in {%Pāṇini'%}s {%Sūtra:%} {#kiM kriyApraSne'nupasarga-#}
{#mapratizidDam#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratizidDa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5452<pc>210-b<k1>apratizeDa<k2>apratizeDa
{#apratizeDa#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-DaH#}) <sup>1</sup> Absence of a prohibition, non-
prohibition, as of a religious act; e. g. in the {%Jaimini Sūtra:%}
{#apratizeDo vA darSanAdiqAyAM syAt#}. Comp. also {#paryudAsa#}.
<sup>2</sup> Absence of negation or contradiction, non-denying (as of
an argument alleged); e. g. in the {%Nyāya Sūtras:%} {#SabdArTa-#}
{#vyavasTAnAdapratizeDaH;#} or {#pratizeDAnupapatteSca pratizedDavyAprati-#}
{#zeDaH;#} or in the {%Vedānta Sūtra:%} {#vijYAnAdiBAve vA tadapra-#}
{#tizeDaH#}. <sup>3</sup> Non-exception (as to a rule); e. g. in the {%Vārttika%}
to {%Pāṇ.%} VIII. 4. 3.: {#apratizeDo vA yaTA sarvanAmasaMjYAyAm#}.
<sup>4</sup> A bad or invalid objection (against an argument), used
frequently in this sense in the {%Nyāya Sūtras;%} e. g. {#ganDatvA-#}
{#dyavyatirekAdganDAdInAmapratizeDaH#} ‘(what is said before) is an
invalid objection, for odours (scents &c.) have no other
nature than that of odour’. <sup>5</sup> A useless exception, an ex-
ception which need not have been made; e. g. when {%Kātyā-%}
{%yana%} criticises the mentioning of the word {#nyubja#} in {%Pāṇini'%}s
rule VII. 3. 61.: {#nyubjeH kartftvAdapratizeDaH#} ({%Patanjali:%} {#anarTakaH#}
{#pratizeDo'pratizeDaH#}); or when a successor of {%Kātyāyana%}
criticises the latter for finding fault with {%Pāṇ.%} VI. 4. 110.,
he says of the {#pratizeDa#} of {%Kātyāyana%} that it is an {#apratizeDa;#}
and in the same manner he turns into ridicule the criticism
of {%Kātyāyana%} on {%Pāṇ.%} I. 1. 22.: {#GasaMjYAyAM nadItare pratizeDaH#}
by substituting for the latter words {#nadItare'pratizeDaH,#}
when {%Patanjali%} gives the same explanation and {%Kaiyyaṭa%}
[Page211-a+ 56]
observes: {#na pratizeDa iti pratizeDanakriyA naYA niziDyate .#}
{#BAzyakArastu vastvarTaM vyAcazwe#}.--E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratizeDa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5453<pc>211-a<k1>apratizkuta<k2>apratizkuta
{#apratizkuta#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) (ved.) <sup>1</sup> Not receding,
not resisted, irresistible ({%Yāska:%} {#apratisKalita#} or {#aprati-#}
{#zkfta#}). <sup>2</sup> Not denied, not met with a refusal ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#apra-#}
{#tiSabdita#} or {#pratikUlaSabdarahita#}). <sup>3</sup> Not refusing, compliant
({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#pratiSabdarahita#} i. e. {#yadyadasmABiryAcyate tatra sarvatra#}
{#neti pratiSabdaM noccArayati#}). E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratizkuta#}.
<LEND>

<L>5455<pc>211-a<k1>apratizWa<k2>apratizWa

{#tastarkaH#}. <sup>2</sup> Want of fame or celebrity. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratizWA#}.

<L>5457<pc>211-a<k1>apratizWita<k2>apratizWita
{#apratizWita#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) <sup>1</sup> Unfixed, unsettled;

{#sAma#} ({%Śaṅkara:%} {#asaMsTitaM parovarIyaH#}). <sup>2</sup> Not strong, not
valid; e. g. {%Śaṅkara%} on a {%Vedānta Sūtra:%} {#yasmAnnirAgamAH#}
{#puruzotprekzAmAtranibanDanAstarkA apratizWitAH saMBavanti#} &c. <sup>3</sup> (In

of poverty to her parents' estate; (according to {%Vijnāneśvara%}
the word would imply: poor {%or childless,%} but the latter qua-
lification is denied by {%Mitramiśra; Gautama:%} {#strIDanaM duhi-#}
{#tFRAmaprattAnAmapratizWitAnAM ca;#} {%Mitākṣara:%} {#apratizWitA a-#}
{#napatyA nirDanA vA;#} {%Vīramitrodaya:%} {#apratizWitA nirDanA . ya-#}
{#dyapi strIDanamityuktaM taTApi tulyanyAyatayA pitfDanavizayamapye-#}
{#tat . banDyatvAdinA saMtAnarahitApratizWiteti tu na yuktam .#}
{#tasyAH saMtAnamuKenAdfzwopakArABAvena DanahAritvAyogAt#}. On
one occasion, however, {%Vijnāneśvara%} explains likewise {#a-#}
{#pratizWitA#} merely by {#nirDanA#}. Comp. the following). E. {#a#}
neg. and {#pratizWita#}.
<LEND>

<L>5460<pc>211-b<k1>apratisaNKyAniroDa<k2>apratisaNKyAniroDa

on the {%Vedānta Sūtra%} {#‘pratisaMKyApratisaMKyAniroDAprAptira-#}
{#vicCedAt’: api ca vEnASikAH kalpayanti budDiboDyaM trayA-#}

{#roDaH . AvaraRABAvamAtramAkASamiti#} &c. E. {#a#} neg. and
{#pratisaNKyAniroDa#}.

<L>5477<pc>212-a<k1>apratIta<k2>apratIta
{#apratIta#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) <sup>1</sup> Not encountered,
unattackable (by enemies), a vaidik epithet, in the {%Ṛgveda,%}
esp. of Indra; e. g. {#apUruzaGno apratIta SUra#} &c., also of a
horse; in the {%Vājasan.%} and {%Atharvav.,%} also of {%Viṣṇu%} and
{%Varuṇa:%} {#apratItA sahoBirvizRU#} &c. <sup>2</sup> Not understood, not
clearly intelligible, as a word; being {#apratIta#} is according
to the {%Kāvyaprakāśa%} one of the seventeen, according to the
{%Sāhityadarpaṇa%} one of the thirteen defects of a word,
which must be avoided in composition; a word is defined
as {#apratIta#} in these works, if it is used in a sense which
it properly has not or may have only in a certain work, as
if in the sentence {#samyagjYAnamahAjyotirdalitASayatAjuzaH .#}
{#viDIyamAnamapyetanna BavetkarmabanDanam,#} or in the sentence {#yo-#}
{#gena dalitASayaH#} the word {#ASaya#} is used in the sense {#vAsanA#}
which it has only in the Yoga philosophy.--See also
{#doza#} and {#padadoza#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratIti#}.
<LEND>

clearly intelligible; one of the defects of a word in
composition; see the preceding. E. {#apratIta,#} taddh. aff.
{#tal#} or {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5485<pc>212-b<k1>apratyakzatA<k2>apratyakzatA (-tA)

{%Vijnānabhikṣu:%} {#apratyakzatayA DarmApalApo na saMBavati;#} or
{%Jayam.:%} {#kAlasyApratyakzatvAtkAryARAM darSanAttaddarSanam#}. E. {#a-#}
{#pratyakza,#} taddh. aff. {#tal#} or {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5486<pc>212-b<k1>apratyakzaSizwa<k2>apratyakzaSizwa
{#apratyakzaSizwa#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-zwaH-zwA-zwam#}) Not distinctly
enjoined, e. g. in the abstract deriv. with taddh. aff. {#tva,#} in
the {%Mīmānsā Sūtra:%} {#tezAmapratyakzaSizwatvAt#}. E. {#a#} neg. and
{#pratyakzaSizwa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5487<pc>212-b<k1>apratyaBijYAna<k2>apratyaBijYAna
{#apratyaBijYAna#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-nam#}) Absence of perception or
recognition; e. g. in the {%Nyāya S.:%} {#apratyaBijYAne ca vinA-#}
{#SapramaNgaH,#} or {#apratyaBijYAnaM ca vizayAntaravyAsaNgAt#}. E. {#a#}
neg. and {#pratyaBijYAna#}.
<LEND>

<L>5488<pc>212-b<k1>apratyaya<k2>apratyaya<h>1
I. {#apratyaya#}¦ 1. Tatpur. m. ({#-yaH#}) <sup>1</sup> Distrust, want of confidence;
e. g. {%Śihlana:%} {#dozARAM saMniDAnaM kapawaSatamayaM kzetramapratyayA-#}
{#nAm#} (scil. {#strIrUpam#}) ‘a woman's figure is…a field for
all kinds of distrust’. <sup>2</sup> The not being perceived, under-
stood or intelligible, the not resulting clearly (comp. {#apra-#}
{#tIti#}); e. g. {%Bharatasena:%} {#rAmeRa…SravaRasuKakAriBi-#}
{#rninAdEH kalahaMsamAlAH pratIyire… . ninAdaSrutivyatireke-#}
{#RApratyaye hetugarBaviSezaRamAha#}. <sup>3</sup> (In Grammar.) <sup>a.</sup> No-affix,
a letter not being an affix or not belonging to an affix;
e. g. in {%Pāṇini'%}s {%Sūtra:%} {#idudupaDasya cApratyayasya#}. <sup>b.</sup> Absence
of an affix; e. g. the {%Kāśikā%} on the ved. loc. sing. {#carman#} or
the voc. {#rAjan#} &c., {#nalopapratizeDavacanAdapratyaya iti pratyaya-#}
{#lakzaRena prAtipadikasaMjYA na pratiziDyate;#} or in the {%Vārtt.%} to
{%Pāṇini:%} {#apratyaye taTEvezwaH#} ({%Kaiyy.:%} {#pratyayABAve'pi pUrvapado-#}
{#ttarapadayoranyatarasya vA lopa ityarTaH#}); or {%Patanjali%} on the
formation {#aBisusU, aBisusUzaterapratyayaH;#} or the same on
{#anusU, anusUterapratyayaH#} (comp. also the remark under 2. 2.).
E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratyaya#}.
<div n="P">2. Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-yaH-yA-yam#}) <sup>1</sup> Having no confi-
dence, distrusting; e. g. in the {%Śakunt.:%} {#A paritozAdviduzAM#}
{#na sADu manye prayogavijYAnam . balavadapi SikzitAnAmAtmanya-#}
{#pratyayaM cetaH#}. <sup>2</sup> (In Grammar.) Having no affix; e. g. {%Pa-%}
{%tanjali%} on the word {#pAd, ayamasti pAdayaterapratyayaH pAt;#}
(as the absence of an affix is in this and similar instances
the effect of the disappearance of an assumed affix {#v#} which
is always dropped, {#apratyaya#} and {#vpratyaya,#} or as the latter word
is written for the sake of euphony {%Pāṇ.%} VI. 2. 52. and VI.
3. 92: {#vapratyaya,#} become synonyms;--comp. the insertion of
an {#a#} for a like purpose in the ādeśa {#adq#} and {%Kaiyyaṭa'%}s
remark on VII. 1. 25.: {#tenoccAraRArTo'kAro dakAramAtraM#}
{#tvAdeSaH#}). E. {#a#} priv. and {#pratyaya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5489<pc>212-b<k1>apratyaya<k2>apratyaya<h>2
II. {#apratyaya#}¦ Karmadh. m. ({#-yaH#}) (In Grammar.) The affix
{#a,#} esp. when {#a#} is also the technical name of the affix,
as in {%Pāṇini;%} e. g. the samās. aff. {#a, fc . pur . ap . Dur .#}
{#paTin . ityetadantAtsamAsAtsamAsAnto'pratyayaH syAt;#} or the
[Page213-a+ 56]
kṛt aff. {#a#} (in the {%Kāśikā%} on the word {#BikzA#} of the com-
pound {#BikzAmAtra#} VI. 2. 14.): {#tatra BikzASabdo guroSca hala#}
(III. 3. 103.) {#ityapratyayAnto'ntodAttaH#}. (Instead of II. {#apra-#}
{#tyaya,#} however, the commentaries prefer in general the ex-
pression {#akArapratyaya#}.) E. {#a#} (the letter) and {#pratyaya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5490<pc>213-a<k1>apratyayasTa<k2>apratyayasTa
{#apratyayasTa#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-sTaH-sTA-sTam#}) (In Grammar.)
Not being in, not belonging to, an affix; e. g. in the {%Vārtt.%}
to {%Pāṇ.:%} {#tatrApratyayasTasya pratizeDo vaktavyaH#}. E. {#a#} neg. and
{#pratyayasTa#}.
<LEND>

contradicted. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pratyAKyAta#}.

<L>5493<pc>213-a<k1>apratyAKyeya<k2>apratyAKyeya

to be refuted. <sup>2</sup> Not to be rejected, to be admitted. <sup>3</sup> In-

<L>5507<pc>213-b<k1>apraDAna<k2>apraDAna
{#apraDAna#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-naH-nA-nam#}) Not principal,
subordinate, secondary; e. g. {%Hitop.:%} {#karawako brUte . AvAM#}
{#tAvadapraDAnO#}.--In most instances, however, the word
occurs only as a {%neuter%} either as an attribute to a noun or
absolutely or as part of a compound, in the sense: ‘any
thing secondary, a secondary object, a secondary act &c.’,
e. g. in {%Pāṇini'%}s {%Sūtra:%} {#sahayukte'praDAne;#} or in the {%Kāsikā%}
on {%Pāṇ.%} {#(halAdiH SezaH):…apare tu bruvate . SezaSabdo'yaM#}
{#nivfttyA viSizwamavasTAnamAha . tadavasTAnamuktito yadyapi pra-#}
{#DAnam . aviDeyattvAttu tadapraDAnam . nivfttireva tu viDeyatvA-#}
{#tpraDAnam;#} or in the {%Kārikā%} to {%Pāṇ.%} {#(akaTitaM ca): praDAna-#}
{#karmaRyAKyeye lAdInAhurdvikarmaRAm . apraDAne duhAdInAM Ryante#}
{#kartuSca karmaRaH;#} or in {%Bharatas.%} (on {%Vopadeva'%}s {%Sūtra%} {#sahavA-#}
{#raRa°°#}) {#sahayogasya praDAnApraDAnatvAviSezokteH#} &c. {#… . na#}
{#ca pitAputrasaMbanDena praDAnApraDAnatA#} &c., where the affixes
{#tva#} and {#tal#} belong to the whole compound {#praDAnApraDAna;#}
or in the {%Jaiminīya-nyāyam.:%} {#praDAnasya prayoktftvamapraDAnapra-#}
{#yoktftA#} &c. E. {#a#} neg. and {#praDAna#}.
<LEND>

<L>5508<pc>213-b<k1>apraDAnatA<k2>apraDAnatA

condary or inferior; e. g. in the {%Hitop.:%} {#damanakaH punarAha .#}
{#kiyatA kAlenAmAtyaH praDAnatAmapraDAnatAM vA laBeta;#} or in
the following definition of {#paryudAsa, praDAnatvaM viDeryatra prati-#}

<LEND>

<L>5509<pc>213-b<k1>apraDAnatva<k2>apraDAnatva

<L>5518<pc>214-a<k1>apraBUti<k2>apraBUti
{#apraBUti#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-tiH#}) Want of effort, little effort; e. g. {%Rigv.:%}
{#apraBUtI varuRo nirapaH sfjat;#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#apraBUtI = apraBUtyA#}
{#alpenEva yatnena#}). E. {#a#} neg. and {#praBUti#}.
<LEND>

<L>5519<pc>214-a<k1>apramatta<k2>apramatta
{#apramatta#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-ttaH-ttA-ttam#}) Attentive, assiduous,
vigilant; e. g. in {%Yājnav.:%} {#apramattaScaredBEkzaM sAyAhne nABila-#}
{#kzitaH#} ({%Vijnāneśvara:%} {#apramatto vAkcakzurAdicApalarahitaH#});
or in the {%Bhāgav. Pur.:%} {#kiM nu bAlezu SUreRa kalinADIra-#}
{#BIruRA . apramattaH pramattezu yo vfko nfzu vartate;#} or {#apramattA#}
{#SuciH mnigDA patiM tvapatitaM Bajet#} ({%Śrīdharasv.:%} = {#avahitaH#}
or {#avahitA#}); or in the {%Śāntiparv.:%} {#apramatto BavedrAjA cCi-#}
{#dradarSI parAtmanoH;#} or in the {%Kaṭha-Upan.:%} {#apramattastadA#}
{#Bavati yogo hi praBavApyayO;#} or in an instance of the {%Kāśikā%}
to {%Pāṇ.:%} {#A hotorapramattastizWati#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramatta#}.
<LEND>

<L>5520<pc>214-a<k1>apramada<k2>apramada
{#apramada#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-daH-dA-dam#}) Joyless, sad; e. g.
in the following {#yamakAvalI#} (q. v.) of the {%Bhaṭṭik.,%} describing
the effects of the conflagration of Laṅkā: {#na gajA nagajA#}
{#dayitA dayitA vigataM vigataM lalitaM lalitam . pramadApramadA-#}
{#mahatA mahatAmaraRaM maraRaM samayAtsamayAt;#} ‘the excellent
mountain elephants were not saved, the motion of the birds
ceased, women (lit. woman) became joyless, struck (as it
were) by disease (or by flight), in time there came death
unto the brave, (but) not in battle’; (the commentaries
divide either {#pramadA apramadA#} the latter = {#pramadarahitA harza-#}
{#SUnyetyarTaH,#} or {#pramadA pramadA#} the latter = {#pragato mado yasyA#}
{#iti pramadA harzaSUnyetyarTaH#} i. e. in either case to the same
effect). E. {#a#} priv. and {#pramada#}.
<LEND>

<L>5521<pc>214-a<k1>apramaya<k2>apramaya
{#apramaya#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-yaH-yA-yam#}) (ved.) Immeasurable,
infinite; an epithet of the neuter Brahman ({%Śaṅkara:%} = {#a-#}
{#prameya#}). E. {#a#} priv. and {#pramaya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5522<pc>214-a<k1>apramA<k2>apramA
{#apramA#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-mA#}) The reverse of {#pramA,#} viz. <sup>1</sup> The same
as {#apramARa#} I. q. v.; e. g. in {%Mādhava'%}s {%Jaiminīya-nyāyam.:%}
{#sadAcAro'pramA mA vA nirmUlatvAdamAnatA . azwakAderivE-#}
{#tasya samUlatvAtpramARatA .. holAkotsavAdisadAcArasya mUlaBU-#}
{#tavedABAvAdaprAmARyamiti cet .. na#} &c.; or {#guRanAmatvasaMde-#}
{#hAdapramA codaneti cet . noktanyAyena saMGasya nAmaDeyatvanirRa-#}
{#yAt#}. <sup>2</sup> (In the Vaiśeṣika philosophy.) Knowledge which
is not absolute, viz. knowledge which is either at variance
with the properties of the thing supposed to be known (see
{#viparyAsa#}), as if one believes, he knows ‘Soul or Self when
he attributes to it properties belonging to Body’, or know-
ledge based on doubt (see {#saMSaya#}), as if one does not know
whether ‘an object is a man or a post’. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramA#}.
<LEND>

<L>5523<pc>214-a<k1>apramARa<k2>apramARa
{#apramARa#}¦ I. Tatpur. n. ({#-Ram#}) No-authority, a rule, injunction,
 reasoning, saying, precedent &c. which is not binding, no
standard to be guided by, irrelevancy; (comp. the similar
terms {#apramA, aprAmARya, amA, amAtva, amAna, amAnatA,#}
also {#pramARABAsa#}); e. g. in {%Mādhava'%}s {%Jaiminīya-nyāyam.:%}
{#arTAboDAdapramARaM pikAlamBanacodanA . mEvaM mlecCaprasidDyApi#}
{#tadboDAdavirudDayA;#} or {#aguRatvAdanAmatvAdamantratvAdananvaye .#}
{#azwatvAdyapramARaM cennArTavAdatayAnvayAt;#} or in the {%Nyāya S.:%}
{#roDopaGAtasAdfSyeByo vyaBicArAdanumAnamapramARam,#} or in the
instance s. v. {#anEkAntikatva;#} or {%Śaṅkara%} in the comm. on
the {%Bṛhadār.:%} {#yadi tAvadupanizado brahmEkatvapratipattipramAM#}
{#kurvanti kaTamapramARaM BaveyuH;#} or in a {%Vārtt.%} to {%Pāṇini:%} {#tadDi-#}
{#tArTanirdeSe liNgavacanamapramARaM tasyAvivakzitatvAt#} ‘gender
and number are irrelevant (i. e. not the subject of the rule)
[Page214-b+ 56]
in the chapter on the derivations with taddhitas &c.’
({%Kaiyyaṭa:%} {#apramARamiti . tadvaSAtkAryasya viDinizeDO na#}
{#Bavata ityarTaH#}); or in the {%Śakunt.:%} {#tasyApramARaM vacanaM janasya#}
‘the word of such a person is no-authority, (where {#apramARam#}
is not to be considered as a Bahuvr.). E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramARa#}.
<div n="P">II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-RaH-RA-Ram#}) Immeasurable, im-
mense, infinite; (the word occurs scarcely in this sense in
the classical Sanskṛt; comp. the following articles). E. {#a#}
priv. and {#pramARa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5524<pc>214-b<k1>apramARaSuBa<k2>apramARaSuBa
{#apramARaSuBa#}¦ Bahuvr. m. pl. ({#-BAH#}) (In Buddhistic doctrine.)
The name of a class of divinities which belong to the
second degree of the third dhyāna or contemplation (literally,
according to the Buddh. interpretation, ‘of immeasurable
virtue’). E. {#apramARa#} and {#SuBa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5525<pc>214-b<k1>apramARABa<k2>apramARABa
{#apramARABa#}¦ Bahuvr. m. pl. ({#-BAH#}) (In Buddhistic doctrine.)
The name of a class of divinities which belong to the second
degree of the second dhyāna or contemplation (liter. ‘of
immeasurable splendour’). E. {#apramARa#} and {#ABA#}.
<LEND>

<L>5526<pc>214-b<k1>apramAda<k2>apramAda
{#apramAda#}¦ I. Tatpur. m. ({#-daH#}) <sup>1</sup> Attentiveness, assiduity, vi-
gilance; e. g. {%Śaṅkara%} in the comm. on the {%Kaṭha-Upan.:%}
{#na hi budDyAdicezwABAve pramAdasaMBavo'sti . tasmAtprAgeva bu-#}
{#dDyAdicezwoparamAdapramAdo viDIyate;#} or {%Śāntiparv.:%} {#apramA-#}
{#daSca SOcaM ca rAjYo BUtikaraM mahat;#} or {#apramAdena SikzeTAH kza-#}
{#mAM budDiM DftiM matim#}. ({%Kullūka%} mentions it as one of the {%five%}
kinds of {#niyama#} q. v., but differs in this respect from the
Yoga philosophy where it does not belong to the latter
notion; comp. {#apramAdatA#}. In the Buddh. {%Dhammapada%} it
is the subject of the second chapter.) <sup>2</sup> The former personified
as a son of Dharma (righteousness) who is a son of (the
masc.) Brahman, by Buddhi (intellect), a daughter of Da-
ksha, accord. to the {%Linga Purāṇa.%} E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramAda#}.
<div n="P">II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-daH-dA-dam#}) Attentive, vigilant,
assiduous. Comp. {#apramAdam#}. E. {#a#} priv. and {#pramAda#}.
<LEND>

<L>5527<pc>214-b<k1>apramAdatA<k2>apramAdatA
{#apramAdatA#}¦ f. ({#-tA#}) Attentiveness, vigilance, assiduity. {%Yā-%}
{%jnavalkya%} calls it one of the {%ten%} kinds of {#niyama#} q. v.; but
the Yoga philosophy does not mention it in the definition
of this term; comp. {#apramAda#} I. E. {#apramAda#} II., taddh. aff. {#tal#}.
<LEND>

<L>5528<pc>214-b<k1>apramAdam<k2>apramAdam
{#apramAdam#}¦ Tatpur. ind. Attentively, watchfully, assiduously;
e. g. {%Vājas.:%} {#sapta fzayaH pratihitAH SarIre sapta rakzanti sada-#}
{#mapramAdam#}. [The meaning of this word would apparently
also result from the Bahuvr. {#apramAda#} taken as a neuter in
the accus., but as the latter is udātta on the last syllable,
and as {#apramAdam#} is in the Vedas udātta on the first, it
seems necessary to distinguish both forms etymologically.]
E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramAdam#} ({#mad#} with {#pra,#} kṛt aff. {#Ramul#}).
<LEND>

<LEND>

<L>5530<pc>214-b<k1>apramAdyat<k2>apramAdyat

or {#apramatta;#} e. g. {%Yāska,%} in explaining {%Vājas.%} 34. 55.: {#rakzanti#}
{#sadamapramAdaM saMvatsaramapramAdyantaH#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramAdyat#}.
<LEND>

<L>5531<pc>214-b<k1>apramAyuka<k2>apramAyuka

Immense, very long (comp. {#apramaya#}); in the {%Atharv.:%} {#BadraM#}
{#puruzajIvanaM kfRotvapramAyukam#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramAyuka#}.

<L>5532<pc>214-b<k1>apramita<k2>apramita
{#apramita#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) <sup>1</sup> Not authoritatively
established, unproved; e. g. {%Rāmakṛṣṇatīrtha:%} (the {#mahA-#}
{#vAkya#} of the {%Vedānta%} is) {#nApi rAjapuruze rAjAyamitivadO-#}
[Page215-a+ 56]
{#pacArikam . apramitaBedayorEkyasyOpacArikatvAnupapatteH#}. <sup>2</sup> Un-
bounded, unmeasured. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramita#}.
<LEND>

<L>5533<pc>215-a<k1>apramudita<k2>apramudita
{#apramudita#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) Not delighted,
not happy.
<div n="P">2. n. ({#-tam#}) (In the Sāṅkhya philosophy.) The reverse
of {#pramudita#} q. v., a technical term to denote the incapacity
of removing the pains that are produced by any created
beings viviparous, oviparous, generated by heat and moisture
or springing from the soil (as men, beasts, tame and wild,
birds, reptiles, gnats, musquitoes, lice, bugs, fish, alliga-
tors, trees, stones &c.), by not attending for this purpose
a holy teacher (the removal of such pains being required
for the attainment of final liberation); it is amongst the
seventeen {#budDibaDa#} or obstructions of intellect one of the
eight which are the converse of the {#sidDi#} or perfections.
For the other terms of this category see {#atAra#} (Supple-
ment), {#atAratAra#} (Supplement), {#apramoda, apramodamAna,#}
{#aramyaka, asadApramudita, asutAra#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramudita#}.
<LEND>

<L>5534<pc>215-a<k1>apramUra<k2>apramUra
{#apramUra#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-raH-rA-ram#}) (ved.) Not foolish,
not heedless, prudent. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramUra#}.
<LEND>

<L>5535<pc>215-a<k1>apramUrcCita<k2>apramUrcCita
{#apramUrcCita#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) The same as the
preceding (of which it occurs as an explanation). E. {#a#}
neg. and {#pramUrcCita#}.
<LEND>

<L>5536<pc>215-a<k1>apramfzya<k2>apramfzya
{#apramfzya#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-zyaH-zyA-zyam#}) Not to be overcome,
not to be injured, not to be disturbed. E. {#a#} neg. and
{#pramfzya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5537<pc>215-a<k1>aprameya<k2>aprameya
{#aprameya#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-yaH-yA-yam#}) <sup>1</sup> Immeasurable,
unbounded, infinite; e. g. in the {%Lalitav.:%} {#(boDisattvaH)#}
{#vyavalokayata pUrvadakziRapaScimottarAsvaDa UrDvaM samantAddaSadi-#}
{#kzvaprameyAsaMKyeyAgaRanAsamatikrAntAnboDisattvAn;#} comp. also
{#aprameyAnuBAva#}. <sup>2</sup> Not to be established or proved from
authorities (philosophical writings &c.), unproveable, as
Brahman; e. g. in {%Manu:%} {#tvameko hyasya sarvasya viDAnasya#}
{#svayaMBuvaH . acintyasyAprameyasya kAryatattvArTavitpraBo#} ({%Kullūka:%}
{#aprameyasya mImAMsAdinyAyanirapekzatayAnavagamyamAnaprameyasya#});
or as Viṣṇu; e. g. in the {%Bhāgav. Pur.:%} {#avyaktasyAprameyasya#}
{#nAnASaktyudayasya ca . na vE cikIrzitaM tAta ko vedAdDA svasaM-#}
{#Bavam#} ({%Śrīdharasv.:%} {#avyaktasyAta evAprameyasya#}); or as the
Veda; e. g. in {%Manu:%} {#aSakyaM cAprameyaM ca vedaSAstram#} ({%Kullūka%}
as before).
<div n="P">2. m. ({#-yaH#}) <sup>1</sup> A name or epithet of Viṣṇu; e. g. in the
{%Viṣṇusahasran.:%} {#aprameyo hfzIkeSaH padmanABo'marapraBuH#}. <sup>2</sup> A
name or epithet of Śiva; e. g. in the {%Śivasahasran.:%} {#atarkyA-#}
{#yAprameyAya pramARAya namo namaH;#} or in the {%Vāyu Pur.:%} {#namaH#}
{#kapAlahastAya…aprameyAya#} &c. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prameya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5538<pc>215-a<k1>aprameyAtman<k2>aprameyAtman
{#aprameyAtman#}¦ Bahuvr. m. ({#-tmA#}) A name of Viṣṇu (lit. ‘of
unproveable spirit’); e. g. in the {%Viṣṇusahasran.:%} {#asaMKye-#}
{#yo'prameyAtmA viSizwaH SizwakfcCuciH#}. E. {#aprameya#} and {#Atman#}.
<LEND>

<L>5539<pc>215-a<k1>aprameyAnuBAva<k2>aprameyAnuBAva
{#aprameyAnuBAva#}¦ Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-vaH-vA-vam#}) Of unbounded
energy; e. g. in the {%Bhāgav. Pur.%} (said of Prahrāda): {#apra-#}
{#meyAnuBAvo'yamakutaScidBayo'maraH#}. E. {#aprameya#} and {#anuBAva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5540<pc>215-a<k1>apramoda<k2>apramoda
{#apramoda#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-dam#}) (In the Sāṅkhya philosophy.)
The reverse of {#pramoda#} q. v., a technical term to denote the
incapacity of removing the pains that are produced by cor-
poreal causes (fever, and other disorders of the three tem-
peramental elements air, bile or phlegm) or by mental causes
[Page215-b+ 56]
(privation of what is liked and approximation of what is
disliked), by not attending for this purpose a holy teacher
(the removal of such pains being required for the attain-
ment of final liberation); it is amongst the seventeen {#budDi-#}
{#baDa#} or obstructions of intellect one of the eight which are
the converse of the {#sidDi#} or perfections. Comp. {#apramudita#}
and the following. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pramoda#}.
<LEND>

<L>5541<pc>215-b<k1>apramodamAna<k2>apramodamAna
{#apramodamAna#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-nam#}) (In the Sāṅkhya philosophy.)
The reverse of {#pramodamAna#} q. v., a technical term to denote
the incapacity of removing the pains that are produced by
superhuman, i. e. divine or atmospheric influences (cold,
heat, wind, rain, lightning &c.), by not attending for this
purpose a holy teacher (the removal of such pains being
required for the attainment of final liberation); it is amongst
the seventeen {#budDibaDa#} or obstructions of intellect one of
the eight which are the converse of the {#sidDi#} or perfections.
Comp. {#apramudita#} and {#apramoda#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#apramodamAna#}.
<LEND>

<L>5542<pc>215-b<k1>aprayacCat<k2>aprayacCat
{#aprayacCat#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-n-ntI-t#}) Not giving, not de-
livering; e. g. {%Yājnav.:%} {#rAjadEvopaGAtena paRye dozamupAgate .#}
{#hAnirvikreturevAsO yAcitasyAprayacCataH;#} or {%Mitākṣ.:%} {#apra-#}
{#yacCaMstaTA SulkamanuBUya pumAnstriyam .…SulkamazwaguRaM dApyaH#}.
E. {#a#} neg. and {#prayacCat#}.
<LEND>

{#brahmacArI#} &c. E. {#a#} priv. and {#prayatna#}.

<L>5545<pc>215-b<k1>aprayARi<k2>aprayARi

used only in negative phrases implying an imprecation; e. g.
{#aprayARiste BUyAt#} ‘mayst thou not be able to progress!’.

<L>5547<pc>215-b<k1>aprayApaRi<k2>aprayApaRi

<L>5548<pc>215-b<k1>aprayAvam<k2>aprayAvam
{#aprayAvam#}¦ Tatpur. ind. (ved.) Assiduously, attentively; ({%Mahīdh.%}
= {#apramattam#}). E. According to this comm. the word would
be the acc. neuter of a Bahuvr. {#a#} priv. and {#prayAva,#} but as
it is udātta on the first syllable it seems more correct to
derive it from {#a#} neg. and {#prayAvam#} ({#yu#} with {#pra,#} kṛt aff.
{#Ramul#}).
<LEND>

<L>5549<pc>215-b<k1>aprayukta<k2>aprayukta
{#aprayukta#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-ktaH-ktA-ktam#}) <sup>1</sup> Not employed, not
applied; e. g. in the {%Mīmānsā S.:%} {#nyAyyAni vAprayukte prasaNgaH#}
{#syAt#}. <sup>2</sup> Wrongly used. <sup>3</sup> Not usual, strange, as a word,
although it may be grammatically correct; e. g. in the {%Vārtt.%}
to {%Pāṇ.:%} {#astyaprayuktaH;#} {%Patanjali:%} {#santi vE SabdA aprayuktAH .#}
{#tadyaTA . Uza tera cakra peceti#} (comp. s. v. {#aprayoga#}) {#. kimato#}
{#yatsantyaprayuktAH . prayogAdDi BavAYCabdAnAM sADutvamaDyavasyati .#}
{#ya idAnImaprayuktA nAmI sADavaH syuH . idaM vipratizidDam .#}
{#yaducyate santi vE SabdA aprayuktA iti yadi santi nAprayuktAH .#}
[Page216-a+ 56]
{#aTAprayuktA na santi . santi cAprayuktASceti vipratizidDam#} &c.
(Compare {#aprayoga#}.) According to the {%Kāvyaprak.,%} being
{#aprayukta#} is one of the seventeen, accord. to the {%Sāhityad.,%}
one of the thirteen defects of a word (see {#padadoza#}), which
must be avoided in composition; e. g. in the sentence:
{#yaTAyaM dAruRAcAraH sarvadEva viBAvyate . taTA manye dEvato'sya#}
{#piSAco rAkzaso'Ta vA,#} or in the sentence: {#BAti padmaH#}
{#sarovare,#} the {%masc.%} forms {#dEvataH#} and {#padmaH#} are {#aprayukta;#} or as
the {%Kāvyapr.%} says, although the masc. of {#dEvata#} is gramma-
tically correct, no body uses the word in this gender:
{#atra dEvataSabdo dEvatAni puMsi veti puMsyAmnAto'pi na kena-#}
{#citprayujyate#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prayukta#}.
<LEND>

<L>5550<pc>216-a<k1>aprayuktatA<k2>aprayuktatA
{#aprayuktatA#}¦ f. ({#-tA#}) or {#aprayuktatva#} n. ({#tvam#}) <sup>1</sup> The not being
applied. <sup>2</sup> The being unusual or strange; one of the de-
fects of a word in composition; see the preceding and comp.
{#aprayoga#}. E. {#aprayukta,#} taddh. aff. {#tal#} or {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5551<pc>216-a<k1>aprayucCat<k2>aprayucCat

<L>5554<pc>216-a<k1>aprayoga<k2>aprayoga
{#aprayoga#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-gaH#}) <sup>1</sup> Non-application, non-use; e. g.
in the {%Mīmānsā S.:%} {#aprAptA cAnupapattiH prayoge hi viroDaH#}
{#syAcCabdArTastvaprayogaBUtastasmAdupapadyeta;#} or in {%Pāṇini'%}s {%S.:%}
{#saMBAvane'lamiti cetsidDAprayoge#} (i. e. if the word {#alam#} is
not used in the sentence; {%Kāśikā:%} {#sidDAprayoga ityalamo vi-#}
{#SezaRam . sidDaScedalamo'prayogaH#}). <sup>2</sup> Wrong application (as
of an argument, i. e. arguing, or speaking wrongly); e. g.
in the {%Nyāya S.:%} {#na vyAGAtAdaprayogaH#}. <sup>3</sup> Strangeness, un-
usualness (as of a word), an unusual expression (although
it be grammatically correct); e. g. in the {%Vārtt.%} to {%Pāṇini:%}
{#aprayogaH prayogAnyatvAt;#} {%Patanjali:%} {#aprayogaH KalvapyezAM#}
{#SabdAnAM nyAyyaH#} (comp. the words {#Uza#} &c. in the instance
s. v. {#aprayukta#} 3.) {#. kutaH . prayogAnyatvAt . yadetezAM SabdAnA-#}
{#marTe'nyAnprayuYjate . tadyaTA . Uzetyasya SabdasyArTe kva yUyamuzi-#}
{#tAH . teretyasyArTe kva yUyaM tIrRAH . cakretyasyArTe kva yUyaM kftavantaH .#}
{#pecetyasyArTe kva yUyaM pakvavanta iti#}. Comp. {#aprayuktatA#}. E. {#a#}
neg. or deter. and {#prayoga#}.
<LEND>

<L>5555<pc>216-a<k1>aprayojaka<k2>aprayojaka
{#aprayojaka#}¦ I. Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-jakaH-jikA-jakam#}) Not causing
to be applicable or to exist, not effecting the applicability
or existence of; e. g. in the {%Yoga Sūtra:%} {#nimittamaprayojakaM#}
{#prakftInAM#} &c. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prayojaka#}.
<div n="P">II. Bahuvr. m. f. n. ({#-jakaH-jakA-jakam#}) Not having a
sufficient cause for being applied, not being properly ap-
plicable, useless, irrelevant; e. g. {%Mallinātha%} in his comm.
on the {%Kirāt.:%} {#samarTanIyapraDAnopasarjanaBAvastvaprayojaka iti#}
{#vyaktavivekakAraH;#} or in the {%Kaṇthābharaṇa:%} {#yadaprayojakaM yacca#}
{#gatArTaM vyarTameva vA#} (viz. a word) {#. tasyApi kvApi nirdozaH#}
[Page216-b+ 56]
{#prayogo dfSyate yaTA;#} or in the {%Jaiminīya-nyāyam.:%} {#na ca kra-#}
{#meREva tatsidDerliNgamaprayojakamiti vAcyam#} &c.; or in the
{%Dattakamīm.:%} {#nanvidamaprayojakaM yatpiRqa fkTABAvAdaputra-#}
{#tvamiti#}. E. {#a#} priv. and {#prayojaka#}.
<LEND>

<L>5556<pc>216-b<k1>aprayojakatva<k2>aprayojakatva
{#aprayojakatva#}¦ n. ({#-tvam#}) The being without a sufficient cause, the
not being properly applicable, irrelevancy, uselessness; e. g.
in the {%Mīmānsā S.:%} {#aprayojakatvAdekasmAtkriyeraYCezasya guRaBU-#}
{#tatvAt#} ({%Śabara:%} {#aprayojakatvAt . akasmAtkriyeran . aprayoja-#}
{#kAni SezakAryARi havizAm#}); or {%Vijnānabh.%} on a {%Sāṅkhya S.:%}
{#mahadAdikaM sakartfkaM kAryatvAdityAdyanumAnezvaprayojakatvena vyA-#}
{#pyatvAsidDyA neSvare'numAnam;#} or {%Viśvan.%} on a {%Nyāya S.:%}
{#yatra nAprayojakatvAdyASaNkA tatra nApekzEva;#} or the {%Siddhānta-%}
{%mukt.:%} {#na ca pratyaBijYAM prati tattAsaMskArasya hetutvena pratyaBi-#}
{#jYAyAH saMskArajanyatvena smftitvApattiriti vAcyam . aprayo-#}
{#jakatvAt#}. E. {#aprayojaka,#} taddh. aff. {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5565<pc>217-a<k1>apravftti<k2>apravftti
{#apravftti#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-ttiH#}) <sup>1</sup> Not proceeding, not commenc-
ing, not taking place; e. g. in the {%Mīmānsā Sūtra:%} {#karmaRa-#}
{#stvapravfttitvAtPalaniyamakartfsamudAyasya#} &c.; or in {%Mādhava'%}s
{%Jaim.-nyāyam.:%} {#praDAnakarmaRo'nAkANkzitasya vikftAvapravftte-#}
{#statsaMbadDAH PalAdayo'pyanAkANkzitatvAnnAtidiSyante;#} or in the
modern compilation of a comm. to {%Pāṇini%} (VIII. 1. 73.):
{#uttarasUtrasTaM sAmAnyavacanapadaM BAzyakfdBiratra yojitam . paryA-#}
{#yaSabdezvapravfttaye#} ‘that the word {#sAmAnyavacana#} may not take
place in, i. e. may not be applied to, synonymes of a word’.
<sup>2</sup> Inactivity, inertion; e. g. in the definition of the term
{#Alasya#} in a comm. of the {%Yoga S.:%} {#AlasyaM kAyacittaguru-#}
{#tvAdapravfttiH#}. <sup>3</sup> (In Medicine.) Stoppage of the natural func-
tions of the body, as suppression of the evacuations &c.;
e. g. in {%Suśruta:%} {#taTA majjagate rukca na kadAcitpraSAmyati .#}
{#apravfttiH pravfttirvA vikftiH Sukrage'nile#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#pravftti#}.
<LEND>

<L>5566<pc>217-a<k1>apravfdDa<k2>apravfdDa
{#apravfdDa#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-dDaH-dDA-dDam#}) Not full grown, not
very large &c.; see the meanings of {#pravfdDa#}. [N. B. This
word is mentioned in the modern compilation of a comm.
to {%Pāṇini%} as an instance to the ākritigaṇa {#pravfdDAdi#} (VI. 2.
147.), when it would be udātta on the last syllable; but it
occurs neither in the {%Kāśikā,%} nor in the {%Siddhaṇtak.%} and
its comm., the {%Praudhamanor.,%} nor in {%Nṛsinha'%}s {%Swara-%}
{%mañjarī;%} and as {%Patanjali%} and his commentators {%Kaiyyata%}
and {%Nagojibhaṭṭa%} have no gloss on this Sūtra, it becomes
very doubtful whether the quoted Gaṇa extends to the word
{#pravfdDa#} in composition with the neg. {#a#}.] E. {#a#} neg. and {#pravfdDa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5571<pc>217-a<k1>apraSasta<k2>apraSasta
{#apraSasta#}¦ m. f. n. ({#-staH-stA-stam#}) I. Tatpur. <sup>1</sup> Not good, in-
ferior, bad, evil; e. g. in the {%Nalop.:%} {#viBItakaScApraSastaH#}

{#ekavaraRadvivaraRe apraSaste api yadA kartavye . tadA trivaraRasya#}

{#RAvavadyAccayata Imaryamo apraSastAn#} ({%Sāyaṇa:%} {#apraSastAn =#}
{#kzIRAnapi padArTAn#}); or {%Parāśara%} (as quoted by {%Rādhāk.%}):
{#apraSastaM niSi snAnaM rAhoranyatra darSanAt#} ‘it is not good to
bathe at night time as Rāhu might see it’.--The neuter
[Page217-b+ 56]
occurs in {%Manu%} in the sense of {%‘dirt, natural excretion’,%}
{#apraSastaM tu kftvApsu mAsamAsIta BEkzaBuk#} ({%Kullūka:%} {#apraSastaM#}
{#mUtrapurIzotsargAdikam#}). E. {#a#} neg. and {#praSasta#}.

<L>5581<pc>217-b<k1>aprasavaDarmin<k2>aprasavaDarmin

and its evolutions, (‘producing’ or ‘prolific’ meaning there

<L>5584<pc>218-a<k1>aprasidDa<k2>aprasidDa

present ed. of the {%Kāvyapr.%} reads it p. 77: {#prakrAntaprasidDA°°;#}

{%nyāyam.:%} {#…vapAvacana urUkaSabdaH . yadyapi vapAyAmaprasidDaH#} &c.

{#aprasidDo'napadeSo'satsaMdigDaScAnapadeSaH;#} where the term
{#aprasidDa#} comprehends according to {%Śaṅkara'%}s {%Upaskāra,%} the

{#vyAptikaSca viparItavyApyatvAsidDavirudDayoH saMgrahaH#}. E. {#a#} neg.
and {#prasidDa#}.

<L>5588<pc>218-a<k1>aprasUtA<k2>aprasUtA

{#mA svEriRI tu sA#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prasUtA#}.
<LEND>

<L>5589<pc>218-a<k1>aprastAvika<k2>aprastAvika
{#aprastAvika#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-kaH-kI-kam#}) Not belonging to
the subject matter (as of a composition); e. g. in the {%Mālatīm.%}
(Kāmandakī answering the question of Lavaṅgikā: ‘who
is Mādhava?’): {#aprastAvikI mahatyezA kaTA;#} ({%Wilson%} takes
[Page218-b+ 56]
the word in the sense ‘requiring no preface’: ‘the story,
though of import, needs no preface’; {%Theatre of the Hindus%}
vol. II. p. 36). E. {#a#} neg. and {#prastAvika#}.
<LEND>

<L>5590<pc>218-b<k1>aprastuta<k2>aprastuta
{#aprastuta#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) Not being the sub-
ject matter (as of a composition, of a sentence &c.), ex-
traneous &c.; the reverse of {#prastuta#} q. v. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prastuta#}.
<LEND>

<L>5591<pc>218-b<k1>aprastutatva<k2>aprastutatva
{#aprastutatva#}¦ n. ({#-tvam#}) The not being the subject matter, ex-
traneousness &c.; see {#aprastuta;#} e. g. in the {%Mitākṣara%} on
{%Yājnav.%} 2. 135.: {#patnI duhitara ityatra niyogasyApratIteH . a-#}
{#prastutatvAcca#}. E. {#aprastuta,#} taddh. aff. {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5592<pc>218-b<k1>aprastutapraSaMsA<k2>aprastutapraSaMsA
{#aprastutapraSaMsA#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-sA#}) (In Rhetoric.) One of the
{#alaNkAra#} q. v. or elegant modes of composition; viz. implied
or indirect expression (literally: conveying--the subject
matter--by what is not the subject matter); more espe-
cially defined as conveying the subject matter, if it is of a
specific nature by means of generalisation, or if it is of a
general kind, by means of specification, or if it is viewed
as a cause, by stating the effect, or if it is viewed as an
effect, by stating the cause, or hinting at the subject matter
by stating what is similar to it, (the latter category being
divided in two varieties which are again split in two other
varieties; while each of the named categories may be,
moreover, threefold, according to whether the expressed
special or general subject, fact, cause or similarity is of a
real or imaginary or mixed nature); an instance of the
second category is the following: {#sragiyaM yadi jIvitApahA#}
{#hfdaye kiM nihitA na hanti mAm . vizamapyamftaM kvacidBavedamftaM#}
{#vA vizamISvarecCayA,#} where the {%general%} idea that the will
of God may turn evil into good and good into evil, is
conveyed by the special instance of poison and amṛta. E.
{#aprastuta#} and {#praSaMsA#}.
<LEND>

<L>5593<pc>218-b<k1>aprahata<k2>aprahata
{#aprahata#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-taH-tA-tam#}) <sup>1</sup> Unhurt, intact.
<sup>2</sup> Untilled, waste, fallow.
<div n="P">2. f. ({#-tA#}) An uncultivated ground, fallow; (according
to the comm. on the {%Amarak.%}). E. {#a#} neg. and {#prahata#}.
<LEND>

<L>5598<pc>218-b<k1>aprAkfta<k2>aprAkfta

belonging to the original or principal substance, subject-

[Page219-a+ 56]
{#prAkftIByo nirvaptavyam . kAstarhi . vEkftIByaH . kutaH . aprAkftena#}
{#devatAviSezeRa saMyogaH SrUyate#} &c.; or {%Mādhava,%} when treating

{#prApayati#} &c.) <sup>2</sup> Not low, not vulgar. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prAkfta#}.

<L>5605<pc>219-a<k1>aprARin<k2>aprARin
{#aprARin#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-RI-RinI-Ri#}) Inanimate, lifeless;
e. g. in {%Manu:%} {#aprARiBiryatkriyate talloke dyUtamucyate#}. (As in
{%Pāṇini'%}s {%Sūtras%} the neg. {#a#} is sometimes used in compo-
sition with a noun, when in ordinary writing it would be
more correct to employ the uncompounded {#na,#} as referring
to the verb of the sentence, the interpretation of the word
{#aprARizu#} in VIII. 3. 72. and therefore the bearing of the
rule itself becomes doubtful; the {%Kāśikā%} takes the Sūtra as
if it ended: {#na prARizu;#} {%Patanjali%} is less positive, for he ex-
claims, after showing the possibility of either acceptation:
{#kiM punaratrArTasatattvam . devA etajjYAtumarhanti;#} but {%Kaiyyaṭa%}
seems to think that if the gods {%must%} know it, the Paṇḍits may
have at least an opinion on the matter, viz. that {#aprARizu#} is
not to be taken there in the sense of {#na prARizu,#} as the unity
of the Sūtra would become disturbed by such an interpre-
tation: {#devA iti . paRqitAH paryudAsaM manyante . saMBavatyekavA-#}
{#kyatve vAkyaBedASrayaRasyAyuktatvAt . prasajyapratizeDe hi vAkyaBe-#}
{#do'vaSyaMBAvI;#} this latter view is also taken by {%Bhaṭṭojid.%})
E. {#a#} neg. and {#prARin#}.
<LEND>

<L>5606<pc>219-a<k1>aprAtilomya<k2>aprAtilomya
{#aprAtilomya#}¦ Tatpur. n. ({#-myam#}) Compliance, favour; e. g.
in {%Pāṇini:%} {#aNgAprAtilomye#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prAtilomya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5609<pc>219-a<k1>aprApta<k2>aprApta
{#aprApta#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-ptaH-ptA-ptam#}) <sup>1</sup> Not obtained, not
taken possession of; e. g. in the {%Bhāṣāp.:%} {#aprAptayostu yA#}
{#prAptiH sEva saMyoga IritaH#} ‘conjunction is called the taking
possession (mutually) of two objects that did not possess
each-other (before)’. <sup>2</sup> Not arrived, not taken place, not
occurred; e. g. in the {%Hitopad.:%} {#aprApte prastAve na vaktumarhasi#}.
[Page219-b+ 56]
<sup>3</sup> Not authorized, not justified or established by a rule, in-
junction &c., unproved; e. g. in a {%Pūrvap.%} of an {%Adhikar.%} of
{%Mādhava'%}s {%Jaimin.-nyāyam.:%} {#prAptasya pravfttiratIteti na tanni-#}
{#vAraRaM Sakyam . aprAptasya bADAvizayatvenAvasTAnameva nAsti;#}
or {#vazawkartA hotA . tasya BakzaRaM samAKyayA prAptam . prATamyaM#}
{#tvaprAptam#} &c.; or in a {%Vārttika%} to {%Pāṇini%} (VI. 3. 10.): {#aprApte#}
{#samAsaviDAnam#} (the preceding Vārttika having established
an {#aprAptaviBAzA#} q. v.: {%Patanjali%} on the latter {%Vārtt.:%} {#ki-#}
{#miyaM prApte viBAzA . AhosvidaprApte .…astu tarhyaprAptA#});
compare also the following articles {#aprAptabADa#} &c. E. {#a#}
neg. and {#prApta#}.
<LEND>

<L>5610<pc>219-b<k1>aprAptakAla<k2>aprAptakAla
{#aprAptakAla#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-laH-lA-lam#}) <sup>1</sup> Under age;
comp. {#aprAptavyavahAra#}. <sup>2</sup> Out of time, not yet im time, in-
opportune, unseasonable; e. g. in the {%Hitopad.:%} {#aprAptakA-#}
{#lavacanaM vfhaspatirapi bruvan . prApnuyAdbudDyavajYAnamapamAnaM ca#}
{#SASvatam;#} comp. {#aprAptAvasara#}.
<div n="P">2. n. ({#-lam#}) (In the Nyāya philosophy.) A discussion
contrary to the order in which it ought to be conducted
(one of the twenty-two {#nigrahasTAna#} or failures in argumen-
tation), the regular order of a discussion being ‘first the
statement and the general argument on the part of the pro-
poser of the argument, then the reply of the opponent,
then the defence of the proposer and lastly victory or de-
feat’. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prAptakAla#}.
<LEND>

<L>5611<pc>219-b<k1>aprAptakAlatva<k2>aprAptakAlatva
{#aprAptakAlatva#}¦ n. ({#-tvam#}) The not yet being in time, the being
out of time, unseasonableness; e. g. in the {%Jaimini Sūtra:%}
{#avakIrRI paSuSca tadvadADAnasyAprAptakAlatvAt#} ({%Śabara:%} {#aprA-#}
{#pto vADAnasya kAla ityetaduktam#}); or {#na tUtpanne yasya codanA-#}
{#prAptakAlatvAt#}. E. {#aprAptakAla,#} taddh. aff. {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5612<pc>219-b<k1>aprAptatA<k2>aprAptatA
{#aprAptatA#}¦ f. ({#-tA#}) or {#aprAptatva#} n. ({#tvam#}) <sup>1</sup> The not being at-
tained or acquired. <sup>2</sup> The not having come, the not taking
place, the not occurring. <sup>3</sup> The not being justified or esta-
blished by an injunction, rule &c., the not being proved;

{#Dasya;#} or in the {%Jaimin.-nyāyam.:%} {#sOmikaM prAkftaM vA syAddU-#}
{#yoH praRayanaM Srutam . Adyo'prAptatvato mEvamanAmatvena vAdagIH;#}
or {#prAyaRIyasya pUrvamaprAptatayA…anekErguRErviSizwaM karmEkena#}
{#vAkyena viDAtuM Sakyam;#} compare also the instance s. v.
{#apUrvArTatva#} and see {#aprApti#}. E. {#aprApta,#} taddh. aff. {#tal#} or {#tva#}.
<LEND>

<L>5613<pc>219-b<k1>aprAptapratizeDa<k2>aprAptapratizeDa

<L>5615<pc>219-b<k1>aprAptabADa<k2>aprAptabADa

<L>5618<pc>220-a<k1>aprAptaviDAna<k2>aprAptaviDAna

<L>5619<pc>220-a<k1>aprAptaviDi<k2>aprAptaviDi
{#aprAptaviDi#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-DiH#}) The same as the preceding;
e. g. in a {%Vārttika%} on {%Pāṇini%} {#‘viBAzAgrepraTamapUrvezu’: agrA-#}
{#dizvaprAptaviDeH samAsapratizeDaH#}. E. {#aprApta#} and {#viDi#}.
<LEND>

<L>5620<pc>220-a<k1>aprAptaviBAzA<k2>aprAptaviBAzA
{#aprAptaviBAzA#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-zA#}) (In Grammar, esp. in the com-
mentaries on {%Pāṇini.%}) An option, enjoined by a rule, if the
latter does not refer to, and therefore is not a restriction of,
another, previous or subsequent, rule; it is distinct there-
fore from the {#prAptaviBAzA#} or the option enjoined by a rule
which is a restriction of another rule, and the {#uBayatravi-#}
{#BAzA#} or the option enjoined by a rule some portion of
which is and some portion of which is not a restriction of
another rule. It follows from this distinction that in {%Pā-%}
{%ṇini'%}s definition of {#viBAzA#} (I. 1. 44. {#‘na veti viBAzA’#}) both
terms {#na#} and {#vA#} apply {%simultaneously%} only to the {#prAptavi-#}
{#BAzA#} and {#uBayatraviBAzA#} and even more properly to the
latter alone, while only {#vA#} can be predicated of the {#aprA-#}
{#ptaviBAzA,#} its purport not being negative with regard to
another rule but purely optional in itself; {%Patanjali:%} {#tatra#}
{#yA tAvadaprApte viBAzA tatra pratizeDyaM nAstIti kftvA vetyanena#}
{#vikalpo Bavizyati . yA hi prApte viBAzA tatroBayamupasTitaM#}
{#Bavati . neti ca veti ca . tatra netyanena pratizidDe vetyanena vi-#}
{#kalpo Bavizyati ..…uBayatraviBAzArTA ceyaM saMjYA . prA-#}
{#ptaviBAzAyAmaprAptaviBAzAyAM ca saMjYAkaraRasyAnupayogAt .#}
{#taTA hi . prAptaviBAzAsu pakze nivfttiH kriyate pakze tu pravfttiH#}
{#sTitEva . aprAptaviBAzAsu ca pakze kAryasya pravfttiH kriyate pa-#}
{#kzAntare tvapravfttiH sTitEveti nAsti tatra saMjYAPalam#} &c.…
({%Nagojibh.:%} {#evaM ca kevalaprAptaviBAzAyAmuBayatraviBAzAyAM#}
{#ca krameRa nizeDavikalpayorupasTitiH . SudDAprAptaviBAzAyAM#}
{#tu nizeDasyAnvayAyogyatvAcCudDavikalpopasTitiriti tAtparyam#}
&c. &c.) Such {#aprAptaviBAzA#} are in {%Pāṇini,%} e. g. in the
{%Sūtras:%} I. 1. 32, 2. 3, 2. 16, 3. 43; II. 4. 12; III. 1. 38, 1. 61,
3. 188, 4. 24; VI. 1. 208(?), 2. 161, 3. 59, 3. 72, 3. 106; VII. 3. 9,
4. 81; VIII. 1. 26, 2. 21; when in consequence of such an in-
terpretation of the option, the Sūtra I. 2. 16 e. g. becomes dis-
connected from I. 2. 15, II. 4. 12 from II. 4. 6, III. 1. 61 from
III. 1. 66, III. 4. 24 from III. 4. 22 &c. &c.--Compare also
{#prAptaviBAzA, uBayatraviBAzA#} and {#vyavasTitaviBAzA#}. E. {#a-#}
{#prApta#} (in the sense of a locative) and {#viBAzA#}.
<LEND>

<L>5621<pc>220-a<k1>aprAptavyavahAra<k2>aprAptavyavahAra
{#aprAptavyavahAra#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-raH#}) (In law.) A minor, one
incapable from nonage of conducting his own affairs; (ac-
cording to {%Kṛṣṇa Tarkal.,%} a boy not more than fifteen
years old: {#aprAptavyavahArA vAlakAH paYcadaSavarzAdanaDikava-#}
{#yaskAH;#} according to the {%Mitākṣara,%} a boy under sixteen
years, the same as {#pOgaRqa#}); his inherited property must
be confided to the care of relatives or friends; ({%Kātyāyana:%}
{#aprAptavyavahArARAM DanaM vyayavarjitam . nyaseyurbanDumitrezu#}); he
is not amenable for the debts of his deceased father, ({%Nā-%}
{%rada:%} {#aprAptavyavahAraScetsvatantro'pi hi narRaBAk;#}) nor liable
[Page220-b+ 56]
to arrest or summons, ({#aprAptavyavahAraSca dUto dAnonmuKo#}
{#vratI . vizamasTaSca nAseDyo na cEtAnAhvayennfpaH#}). E. {#a#} neg.
and {#prAptavyavahAra#}.
<LEND>

<L>5622<pc>220-b<k1>aprAptavyavahArakAla<k2>aprAptavyavahArakAla
{#aprAptavyavahArakAla#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-laH#}) (In Law.) The same
as the preceding. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prAptavyavahArakAla#}.
<LEND>

<L>5623<pc>220-b<k1>aprAptAvasara<k2>aprAptAvasara
{#aprAptAvasara#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. n. ({#-raH-rA-ram#}) Inopportune, un-
seasonable; e. g. in the {%Hitopad.:%} {#damanako'bravIt . mitra#}
{#mA BEzIH . nAhamaprAptAvasaravacanaM vakzyAmi#}. E. {#a#} neg. and
{#prAptAvasara#}.
<LEND>

<L>5624<pc>220-b<k1>aprApti<k2>aprApti
{#aprApti#}¦ Tatpur. f. ({#-ptiH#}) <sup>1</sup> Non-attainment, non-acquisition; e. g.
a quot. in the {%Kāvyaprak.:%} {#tadaprAptimahAduHKavilInASezapAta-#}
{#kA…cintayantI jagatsUtim#} &c. <sup>2</sup> The not taking place,
the not occurring; e. g. in the {%Vedānta Sūtra:%} {#pratisaMKyApra-#}
{#tisaMKyAniroDAprAptiravicCedAt#} ({%Śaṅkara:%} {#aprAptirasaMBava#}
{#ityarTaH#}); or in the {%Sāṅkhya Sūtra:%} {#nAprAptaprakASakatvamindri-#}
{#yARAmaprApteH sarvaprAptervA#}. <sup>3</sup> The not being justified or
established by a rule, injunction, the not being authorized &c.;
e. g. in a {%Vārttika%} to {%Pāṇini:%} {#yUni cAntarhite'prAptiH,#} or
{#grAmaRiputrAdizvaprAptiH,#} or {#itve kagrahaRaM saMGAtagrahaRaM cedeti-#}
{#kAsvaprAptiH;#} or in an {%Adhikar.%} or {%Mādhava:%} {#yaTA deSakA-#}
{#lakartfdravyARAM pakze'prAptO niyamo vihitaH . evamavaGAto#}
{#'pi…niyamyate,#} or {#lOkikAgnO hotuM pustakapAWenADigantuM#}
{#ca SakyatvenADAnopanayanayorakalpane brAhmaRAdInAmaprApteH#} &c.
Compare {#aprAptatva#}. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prApti#}.
<LEND>

<L>5625<pc>220-b<k1>aprAptisama<k2>aprAptisama
{#aprAptisama#}¦ Tatpur. m. f. ({#-maH-mA#}) (In the Nyāya philosophy.)
One of the two sophisms on the irrelevancy of the notion
‘cause’; viz. arguing that if a cause is stated the charac-
teristics of which cannot be proved--as by saying that
the Śyena sacrifice inflicts pain on enemies--, such charac-
teristics prevent a cause from proving the effect, i. e. from
being a valid cause; ({#‘yadi cAprAptaM liNgaM sADyabudDiM janayati#}
{#sADyABAvabudDimeva kiM tena na janayet’#}); the refutation is:
that such a cause is nevertheless valid, since it is an ideal
cause, mentioned in the Veda.--For the other sophism
on the irrelevancy of cause see {#prAptisama#}. E. {#aprApti#} and
{#sama#}. (For the gender of this word and the ellipsis required
to explain it, see the etym. of {#anityasama#}.)
<LEND>

attainable. E. {#a#} neg. and {#prApya#}.
<LEND>

<L>5627<pc>220-b<k1>aprApyagrahaRa<k2>aprApyagrahaRa

{#pawalasPawikAntaritopalabDeH#}. E. {#aprApya#} and {#grahaRa#}.
<LEND>

<L>5633<pc>221-a<k1>aprAyu<k2>aprAyu

<L>5634<pc>221-a<k1>aprAyus<k2>aprAyus
{#aprAyus#}¦ Tatpur. m. ({#-yuH#}) (ved.) With ungone life, with
brilliant vigour; an epithet of Agni whose life or brilliancy
does not vanish before daylight, although all other beings
appear, as it were, lifeless during night (according to
{%Sāyaṇa'%}s interpretation of {%Ṛgv.%} I. 127. 5.). E. {#a#} neg. and
{#prAyus#}.
<LEND>

<L>5636<pc>221-a<k1>apriya<k2>apriya
{#apriya#}¦ Tatpur. 1. m. f. n. ({#-yaH-yA-yam#}) <sup>1</sup> Unkind, un-
friendly; e. g. in the {%Taittirīya-Up.:%} {#pari ye'priyA BrAtfvyAH#}.
<sup>2</sup> Disliked, disagreeable, offensive; e. g. in the {%Hitopad.:%}
{#na strIRAmapriyaH kaScitpriyo vApi na vidyate . gAvastfRami-#}
{#vAraRye prArTayanti navaM navam;#} or {#apriyasyApi paTyasya pari-#}
{#RAmaH suKAvahaH;#} or in the {%Bhaṭṭik.:%} {#UrDvaM mriye muhUrtAdDi#}
{#vihvalaH kzatabAnDavaH . mantre sma hitamAKyAmi na karomi tavA-#}
{#priyam;#} or in {%Gaurapāda%} on the {%Sāṅkhyakār.:%} {#priyasamAga-#}
{#mApriyaparihArakawutiktakazAyAdikvATAdiBirdfzwa eva ADyA-#}
{#tmikopAyaH#}.
<div n="P">2. m. ({#-yaH#}) <sup>1</sup> A foe, an enemy. <sup>2</sup> The name of a
Yaksha (in Buddhistic mythology).
<div n="P">3. f. ({#-yA#}) A sort of skeat (Silurus pungentissimus).
E. {#a#} neg. and {#priya#}.
<LEND>
